note1.para: Note. The alkali metals are lithium, sodium, potassium, rubidium, cesium, and francium.
Note. The alkaline earth metals are magnesium, calcium, strontium, barium, and radium.

subclass.sctitle: Albumin or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the proteinaceous material is albumin or a chemical modification of albumin.

note1.para: Note. Albumins are proteins characterized by heat coagulability and solubility in dilute salt solution. The most notable albumins are ovalbumin, serum albumin, lactalbumin, grain and soybean albumins.
Note. Example of derivative included herein is the metal salt of the albumin.

subclass.sctitle: Casein or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the proteinaceous material is casein or a chemical modification of casein.

note1.para: Note. Casein is the principal protein in milk. It is a phosphoprotein consisting of about 15 amino acids and has a molecular weight ranging from 75,000 to 375,000.
Note. Example of derivative included herein is the metal salt of the casein.

descript.para: for compositions containing milk.

subclass.sctitle: Gelatin or collagen or derivative (e.g., glue, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the proteinaceous material is gelatin, collagen, or a chemical modification of gelatin or collagen.

note1.para: Note. Gelatin is derived from collagen by boiling skin, tendons, ligaments, bones, etc. with water.
Note. Collagen is a protein with a molecular weight of about 130,000. It is the main constituent of skin, connective tissue, and the organic substance of bones and teeth.

descript.para: for compositions containing tissue derived from multicellular animal.

subclass.sctitle: Prolamine or derivative (e.g., zein, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the proteinaceous material is prolamine or derivative thereof.

note1.para: Note. Prolamines are those proteins contained in cereal grains which are soluble in strong alcohol and insoluble in water. Prolamine from corn is known as zein; from wheat, gleadin; from rye, hordein.

subclass.sctitle: Carbohydrate or derivative containing:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic composition containing a carbohydrate or derivative thereof.

note1.para: Note. The term “carbohydrate or derivative” in this and indented subclasses corresponds to Class 536, subclass 1.11 definition; i.e., saccharide whose monomeric units are polyhydroxy mono-aldehydes or polyhydroxy mono-ketones, having the formula Cn(H2O)n (wherein n is five or six), or the corresponding cyclic hemiacetals thereof; or the reaction derivatives thereof in which the carbon skeleton and the carbonyl function or hemi-acetal function of the saccharide unit are not destroyed.

Note. The expression “organic compound” in this and indented subclasses corresponds to the Class 260 class definition; i.e., compounds containing carbon, which are further characterized by the presence in a molecule thereof of (a) two carbon atoms bonded together, (b) one atom of carbon bonded to at least one atom of hydrogen or halogen, or (c) one atom of carbon bonded to at least one atom of nitrogen by a single or double bond, with the proviso that HCN, CN-CN, HNCO, HNCS, cyanamide, cyanogen halides, fulminic acid, metal carbides, and graphite are excluded from being organic compounds.

descript.para: appropriate subclass for processes of production, purification, extraction, etc., of starch and sugar, and products of such processes.
for a nonstructural laminate including a layer comprising carbohydrate.
for the liberation or treatment of carbohydrates by fermentation processes.

and 509 and Class 524, subclasses 9+, 27+ 702+, 716, and 732+ for a carbohydrate or derivative nonreactant material in admixture with a synthetic resin or natural rubber; and Classes 525, 526, 527, and 528 for a carbohydrate or derivative containing synthetic resin, and see Class 520, subclass 1 for an explanation of the type of polymer derived from a protein reactant which is proper for Class 520 (Note 9, C).
for a carbohydrate prepared by a synthesis other than hydrolytic conversion of a carbohydrate.

subclass.sctitle: Aminopolysaccharide (e.g., heparin, glycosamine, mucopolysaccharide, chitin, hyaluronic acid, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbohydrate is a polysaccharide with an amino group therein.

subclass.sctitle: With lignocellulosic material (i.e., mixture of a lignocellulosic material and a carbohydrate material which is other than a lignocellulosic material or a component thereof):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a lignocellulosic material in addition to the carbohydrate or derivative whereby the carbohydrate or derivative is not a lignocellulosic material or a constituent thereof.

note1.para: Note. Lignocellulosic material is raw vegetable matter consisting primarily of cellulose, primarily of cellulose and lignin, or primarily of cellulose and lignin and minor amounts of carbohydrate and resin. Lignocellulosic materials include but are not limited to straw, bagasse, corn stalk, grass, wood pulp, wood, bark.

Note. Lignin is a noncarbohydrate, polymeric substance found in wood and woody plants which functions as a natural plastic binder for the cellulose fibers. It is isolated directly from wood or wood products or from the treatment of wood, e.g., waste sulfite liquor or black liquor. The structure of the lignin monomer is not completely known.

descript.para: 162.7, 162.8, and 162.9 for compositions containing carbohydrate or derivative and cellulose xanthate, cellulose ester or salt thereof, cellulose ether or salt thereof, or cellulose or derivative.
for definition of cellulose.
for compositions containing one or more lignocellulosic materials.

subclass.sctitle: The carbohydrate is starch:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbohydrate is a polysaccharide in plants (e.g., corn, potatoes, tapioca, rice, wheat, etc.) which has amylose and amylopectin as the main ingredients.

note1.para: Note. Starches are heterogenous in that the amylose and amylopectin occur in different ratios to each other.
Note. Included herein are starch fractions such as amylose and amylopectin as well as modified starches (e.g., thin boiling starches, etc.).

subclass.sctitle: With cellulose xanthate or viscose (i.e., mixture of cellulose xanthate or viscose and a carbohydrate material which is other than cellulose xanthate or viscose):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain cellulose xanthate or viscose in addition to the carbohydrate or derivative whereby the carbohydrate or derivative is not cellulose xanthate or viscose.

note1.para: Note. Cellulose xanthate or viscose is a cellulose derivative with the group:
Note. The viscose process is based on the reaction of carbon disulfide with the sodium salt of cellulose to yield a xanthate, which forms a viscous colloidal solution in dilute aqueous alkali.

descript.para: 162.7, 162.8, and 162.9, for compositions containing carbohydrate or derivative and lignocellulosic material, cellulose ester or salt, cellulose ether or salt, or cellulosic material.

subclass.sctitle: With cellulose ester or salt thereof (i.e., mixture of (a) a cellulose ester or salt thereof and (b) a carbohydrate material which is other than cellulose ester or salt of the same acid as in (a) differing only in the degree of esterification):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain (a) a cellulose ester or salt thereof in addition to (b) the carbohydrate or derivative thereof whereby the carbohydrate or derivative cannot be a cellulose ester or salt of the same acid as in (a) differing only in the degree of esterification.

note1.para: Note. This subclass provides for compositions containing both a and b as defined below:

note2.para: cellulose ester such as (1) cellulose ester of a single acid (e.g., cellulose acetate, cellulose propionate, etc.), (2) cellulose ester of mixed acids (e.g., cellulose butyrate propionate, cellulose propionate isobutyrate, etc.), or (3) mixture of cellulose esters of the same acid differ only in the degree of esterification (e.g., pyroxylin - mixture of cellulose tetranitrate and cellulose trinitrate, mixture of cellulose acetate and cellulose triacetate, etc.), and

descript.para: 162.6, 162.8, and 162.9, for compositions containing carbohydrate or derivative and lignocellulosic material, cellulose xanthate, cellulose ether or salt, or cellulosic material.

for compositions containing two or more different cellulose esters (e.g., cellulose nitrate and cellulose acetate, cellulose propionate and cellulose acetate, cellulose propionate and cellulose propionate isobutyrate, etc.).
for definition of cellulose ester or salt thereof.
for compositions containing pyroxylin as the only carbohydrate or derivative and the only cellulose ester or derivative.

subclass.sctitle: The carbohydrate is a cellulose material:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbohydrate derivative is cellulose, chemically modified cellulose wherein the carbon skeleton of the cellulose is not destroyed, or a naturally occurring material which has cellulose as one of its ingredients.

descript.para: for definition of cellulose or derivative thereof.

subclass.sctitle: Diverse cellulose ester or salt thereof (i.e., mixture of two or more cellulose esters or salts of diverse acids or mixture of two or more cellulose mixed esters or salts of different diverse acids groups):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain (a) mixture of two or more cellulose esters or salts thereof whereby at least one cellulose ester or salt has a diverse acid group or (b) mixture of two or more mixed cellulose esters or salts thereof whereby at least one mixed cellulose ester or salt has a diverse mixed acids group.

note1.para: Note. Cellulose ester is a product of a reaction of a hydroxyl group of cellulose with an acid. The esterifying acid may be organic or inorganic.

Note. This subclass provides for compositions containing two or more different cellulose esters (e.g., cellulose nitrate and cellulose acetate, cellulose propionate and cellulose acetate, cellulose propionate and cellulose propionate isobutyrate, etc.).

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose mixed esters or mixture of cellulose esters of the same acid different only in the degree of esterification (e.g., cellulose acetate propionate, cellulose propionate and cellulose tripropionate, etc.).
for compositions containing mixture of cellulose acetate of differing degree of esterification (e.g., cellulose acetate and cellulose triacetate, etc.).

subclass.sctitle: With cellulose ether or salt thereof (i.e., mixture of (a) a cellulose ether or salt thereof and (b) a carbohydrate material which is other than cellulose ether or salt of the same etherifying radical as in (a) differing only in the degree of etherification):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain (a) a cellulose ether or salt thereof in addition to (b) the carbohydrate or derivative whereby the carbohydrate or derivative cannot be a cellulose ether or salt of the same etherifying radical as in (a) differing only in the degree of etherification.

note1.para: Note. Cellulose ether is a cellulose derivative having a general formula ROR4, wherein RO- is the cellulose residue moiety and R4 is an ether forming radical.
Note. Cellulose ether is made by etherifying the hydroxyl groups of cellulose.

descript.para: for compositions containing mixture of cellulose ethers.

subclass.sctitle: The carbohydrate is starch or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbohydrate is a polysaccharide in plants (e.g., corn, potatoes, tapioca, rice, wheat, etc.) which has amylose and amylopectin as the main ingredients or derivatives thereof.

note1.para: Note. Starches are heterogenous in that the amylose and amylopectin occur in different ratios to each other.
Note. Included herein are starch fractions such as amylose and amylopectin as well as modified starches (e.g., thin boiling starches, etc.).

subclass.sctitle: The carbohydrate is diverse cellulose ether or salt thereof (i.e., mixture of two or more cellulose ethers or salts of diverse etherifying radicals or mixture of two or more cellulose mixed ethers or salts of different diverse etherifying radical groups):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbohydrate derivative is a diverse cellulose ether or salt thereof or a diverse cellulose mixed ethers or salts thereof.

note1.para: Note. This subclass provides for compositions containing two or more different cellulose ethers or mixed ethers or salts thereof (e.g., methyl cellulose and ethyl cellulose, methyl propyl cellulose and ethyl butyl cellulose, etc.).

subclass.sctitle: With cellulosic material (i.e., mixture of a cellulosic material and a carbohydrate material which is other than a cellulosic material):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain (a) a naturally occurring material which has cellulose as one of its ingredients, cellulose, or a derivative thereof, and (b) a carbohydrate or derivative thereof whereby the carbohydrate or derivative is not a cellulosic material.

descript.para: 162.6, 162.7, and 162.8, for compositions containing cellulose or other derivatives of cellulose and additional carbohydrate or derivative.
for definition of cellulose or derivative thereof.

subclass.sctitle: Cellulosic material:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbohydrate is cellulose with the following structure, below, or the reaction products wherein the carbon skeleton of the cellulose is not destroyed or a naturally occurring material which has cellulose as one of its ingredients.

note1.para: Note. This subclass and indented subclasses provide for lignocellulosic material (e.g., wood, bark, etc.), relatively pure cellulose (e.g., cotton linters, etc.), regenerated cellulose (e.g., cellophane and rayon), or chemically modified forms of cellulose (e.g., pyroxylin, viscose, etc.) for which there is no provision elsewhere.

Note. The expression “organic compound” in this and indented subclasses corresponds to the Class 260 class definition; i.e., compounds containing carbon, which are further characterized by the presence in a molecule thereof of (a) two carbon atoms bonded together, (b) one atom of carbon bonded to at least one atom of hydrogen or halogen, or (c) one atom of carbon bonded to at least one atom of nitrogen by a single or double bond, with the proviso that HCN, CN-CN, HNCO, HNCS, cyanamide, cyanogen halides, fulminic acid, metal carbides, and graphite are excluded from being organic compounds.

Note. The term “carbohydrate or derivative” in this and indented subclasses corresponds to Class 536, subclass 1.1 definition; i.e., saccharide whose monomeric units are polyhydroxy mono-aldehydes or polyhydroxy mono-ketones, having the formula Cn(H2O)n (wherein n is five or six), or the corresponding cyclic hemiacetals thereof; or the reaction derivatives thereof in which the carbon skeleton and the carbonyl function or hemi-acetal function of the saccharide unit are not destroyed.

Note. The term “alloy” in this and indented subclasses corresponds to Class 75 class definition; i.e., a union, possessing metallic properties of two or more metallic elements or of nonmetallic element(s) and metallic elements(s) which are not pure compounds and which are miscible with each other, which at least to a certain extent when molten forms a more or less homogeneous liquid having a metallic matrix and which does not separate into distinct layers when solid. Such combinations when solidified from a melt may consist of mechanical mixtures, entectics, entectoids, solid solutions, or in part of chemical compounds one or more of which may exist at the same time. Intermetallic compounds are considered alloys for purposes of classification.

Note. The term “hetero ring” in this and indented subclasses corresponds to Class 532 class definition; i.e., a ring having only carbon and at least one atom from the group consisting of nitrogen, oxygen, sulfur, selenium and tellurium as ring members.

descript.para: for compositions containing fireproofing or biocidal agent.
for compositions which are specialized for use as marking, writing, printing, and particularly subclass 31.37 for ink compositions containing cellulose or derivative thereof.
168.01, 169.01, and 172.1, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose ester, cellulose nitrate, or cellulose ether.
for compositions containing inorganic settable ingredients.
for inedible sausage casings, per se, including shirred casings, with more than nominal wall structure.

for processes of liberating cellulosic fibers from natural sources including chemical treatment, and subclasses 100+ for cellulosic fiber containing compositions which are deposited from liquid suspensions.
for compositions containing ultraviolet filtering material or other light transmission modifying materials.

subref.clstitle: Food or Edible Material: Processes, Compositions, and Products

descript.para: , 135, and 138+ for edible food casings or casings containing a food product.

for a flexible casing with nominal wall structure for food products such as sausage, appropriate subclasses for a stock material product in the form of a single or plural layer web or sheet, and particularly subclasses 227+ for such a product comprising intertangled strands or strand-portions, and subclasses 375+ for structurally defined or coated fiber or filament, or a mass thereof.
for cellulose or derivatives thereof, per se.

subclass.sctitle: Lignocellulosic material (e.g., wood, bark, straw, bagasse, wood pulp, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the cellulosic material is raw vegetable matter consisting primarily of cellulose, primarily of lignin and cellulose, or primarily of lignin and cellulose and minor amounts of carbohydrate and resin.

note1.para: Note. Lignin is a noncarbohydrate, polymeric substance found in wood and woody plants which functions as a natural plastic binder for the cellulose fibers. It is isolated directly from wood or wood products or from the treatment of wood, e.g., waste sulfite liquor or black liquor. The structure of the lignin monomer is not completely known.
Note. Lignocellulosic materials include but are not limited to straw, bagasse, corn stalk, grass, wood pulp, wood, bark.

descript.para: for cork or 164.2 for peat.
for compositions containing chemically modified lignocellulosic material of indeterminate structure (e.g., hydrolyzed, etherified, etc.).

subclass.sctitle: Cork:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the lignocellulosic material is (a) the exterior layer of the bark of the cork oak tree or (b) cork, per se.

descript.para: for shoe filling composition with cork.

subclass.sctitle: With fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid, or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cork, fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid, and functional derivative thereof.

note1.para: Note. Definitions are found in the Glossary below.

Note. Examples of derivative included herein are esterified, oxidized, polymerized, vulcanized, hydrogenized fat, or fatty oil and the functional derivative of higher fatty acid such as esters, acid salts, and amides.

Note. Included herein are oils derived from plant and animal origin (e.g., castor, coconut, corn, soybean, olive, cottonseed, safflower, fish, fish-liver, sperm, etc.) and the functional oils, such as drying oils (linseed, tung, oiticica), semidrying oils (soybean, cottonseed), and nondrying oils (castor, coconut).

descript.para: compositions containing lignocellulosic material and organic compound containing chalcogen.
for compositions containing fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid, or derivative in combination with lignocellulosic material and natural resin or derivative.
for compositions containing fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid, or derivative in combination with lignocellulosic material.

def.para: The glyceryl triester (triglyceride) of the same or different higher fatty acids (e.g., oleic, myristic, palmitic, stearic, linolenic, etc.) or mixtures thereof present in a single oil or fat (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, etc.).

Aliphatic monocarboxylic acid containing an unbroken chain of at least seven carbon atoms bonded to a carboxyl group (e.g., lauric, palmitic, stearic, oleic, ricinoleic, linoleic, behenolic, etc.). Where there are several unbroken chains of carbon atoms bonded to the -C(=O)O- group, one of the chains must contain at least seven carbon atoms.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous or tarry residue:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cork, a composition or compound having the characteristics of a tar or pitch no matter what the origin.

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are all asphalts, bitumens, pitches and tars from coal, mineral oil, cotton seed pitch and the residue from the destructive distillation of wood, and natural oil distillations.

descript.para: for compositions containing lignocellulosic material and bituminous or tarry residue.

subclass.sctitle: Peat:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the lignocellulosic material is partially decayed plant matter formed in water-saturated environments, such as bogs and marshes.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the lignocellulosic material, an organic compound which has at least one nitrogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for definition of an organic compound.

169.46+, 170.42+, 190.1, and 200.1+, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt thereof, cellulose ether or salt thereof, or a cellulosic material and an organic compound containing nitrogen.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing chalcogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the lignocellulosic material, an organic compound which has at least one chalcogen atom (i.e., oxygen, sulfur, selenium or tellurium) therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: Natural resin or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing chalcogen is a natural resin or derivative of a natural resin.

note1.para: Note. Natural resins include but are not limited to shellac, copals from various sources (e.g., congo, manila, etc.), amber, dammar, dead dammar, gum rosin, rosin (colophony), tall oil (liquid rosin), wood rosin, burgundy pitch, gurjun balsam, canada balsam, sandrac, mastic, accroides, benzoin, elemi, gamboge, gum thus, venice turpentine, bordeaux turpentine, abietic acid, and pimaric acid.
Note. Examples of derivatives included herein are hydrogenated, esterified, polymerized, or sulfurized resin, or salt thereof.

descript.para: 170.21, and 178.1, for compositions containing natural resin or derivative and cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt thereof, or cellulose ether or salt thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With hydrocarbon (e.g., petroleum fraction, paraffin, olefin, acetylene, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain in addition to the lignocellulosic material and natural resin an organic compound consisting exclusively of the elements carbon and hydrogen.

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose xanthate and hydrocarbon.

subclass.sctitle: With fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid, or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the lignocellulosic material and natural resin, fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid or derivative thereof.

note1.para: Note. Definitions can be found in the Glossary below.

Note. Examples of derivatives included herein are esterified, oxidized, polymerized, vulcanized, hydrogenized fat, or fatty oil and the functional derivative of higher fatty acid such as esters, acid salts, and amides.

Note. Included herein are oils derived from plant and animal origin (e.g., castor, coconut, corn, soybean, olive, cottonseed, safflower, fish, fish-liver, sperm, etc.) and the functional oils, such as drying oils (linseed, tung, oiticica), semidrying oils (soybean, cottonseed), and nondrying oils (castor, coconut).

descript.para: for compositions containing cork and fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid or derivative.
for compositions containing lignocellulosic material and fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid or derivative.

def.para: The glyceryl triester (triglyceride) of the same or different higher fatty acids (e.g., oleic, myristic, palmitic, stearic, linolenic, etc.) or mixtures thereof present in a single oil or fat (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, etc.).

Aliphatic monocarboxylic acid containing an unbroken chain of at least seven carbon atoms bonded to a carboxyl group (e.g., lauric, palmitic, stearic, oleic, ricinoleic, linoleic, behenolic, etc.). Where there are several unbroken chains of carbon atoms bonded to the -C(=O)O- group, one of the chains must contain at least seven carbon atoms.

subclass.sctitle: Fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing chalcogen is fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid or derivative thereof.

note1.para: Note. Definitions are in the Glossary below.

Note. Examples of derivatives included herein are esterified, oxidized, polymerized, vulcanized, hydrogenized fat, or fatty oil and the functional derivative of higher fatty acid such as esters, acid salts, and amides.

Note. Included herein are oils derived from plant and animal origin (e.g., castor, coconut, corn, soybean, olive, cottonseed, safflower, fish, fish-liver, sperm, etc.) and the functional oils, such as drying oils (linseed, tung, oiticica), semidrying oils (soybean, cottonseed), and nondrying oils (castor, coconut).

descript.para: for compositions containing cork and fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid or derivative.
for compositions containing fat, fatty oil, higher fatty acid or derivative in combination with lignocellulosic material and natural resin or derivative.

def.para: The glyceryl triester (triglyceride) of the same or different higher fatty acids (e.g., oleic, myristic, palmitic, stearic, linolenic, etc.) or mixtures thereof present in a single oil or fat (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, etc.).

Aliphatic monocarboxylic acid containing an unbroken chain of at least seven carbon atoms bonded to a carboxyl group (e.g., lauric, palmitic, stearic, oleic, ricinoleic, linoleic, behenolic, etc.). Where there are several unbroken chains of carbon atoms bonded to the -C(=O)O- group, one of the chains must contain at least seven carbon atoms.

subclass.sctitle: With element or inorganic compound except water:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the lignocellulosic material, elemental material or any inorganic compound except water.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
and 204.01+, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate or cellulose and inorganic compound or element, other than water.

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are carbon black, metal alloy, metal dust, sodium chloride, and calcium carbonate.

subclass.sctitle: Elemental silicon or inorganic silicon compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in which the inorganic compound or element is an inorganic compound containing silicon or elemental silicon.

descript.para: 169.55, 170.57, and 203.3, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, cellulose ether or salt, or a cellulosic material and an inorganic compound containing silicon or an elemental silicon.

subclass.sctitle: Asbestos:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in which the compound containing silicon is fibrous calcium magnesium silicate.

subclass.sctitle: Elemental sulfur or inorganic sulfur compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in which the inorganic compound or element is an inorganic compound containing sulfur or elemental sulfur.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous or tarry residue:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a composition or compound having the characteristics of a tar or pitch no matter what the origin.

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are all asphalts, bitumens, pitches and tars from coal, mineral oil, cotton seed pitch and the residue from the destructive distillation of wood, and natural oil distillations.

descript.para: for compositions containing cork and bituminous or tarry residue.

subclass.sctitle: Chemically modified lignocellulosic material of indeterminate structure (e.g., hydrolyzed, etherified, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the cellulosic material is found in a hydrolyzed, etherified, or other reaction products of lignocellulosic material of indeterminate structure.

subclass.sctitle: Cellulose xanthate or viscose:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the cellulosic material contains the group:

note1.para: Note. The viscose process is based on the reaction of carbon disulfide with the sodium salt of cellulose to yield a xanthate, which forms a viscous colloidal solution in dilute aqueous alkali.

subref.clstitle: Plastic and Nonmetallic Article Shaping or Treating: Processes

descript.para: for processes of forming indefinite or continuous length articles from viscose spinning solutions by extrusion thereof into a specified precipitating medium as defined, see Class 264 definitions, Lines With Other Classes, “Lines With The Chemical Composition Classes,” (5). Where an additive is included in a molding composition or a treating bath for purposes of preventing fouling of equipment, see Class 264, subclass 170.
for viscose, per se, and its subsequent treatment.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing silicon:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one silicon atom therein in addition to the cellulose xanthate.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
170.2, and 177.1, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, or cellulose ether or salt and organic compound containing silicon.

subclass.sctitle: With phosphorus compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a compound of phosphorus in addition to the cellulose xanthate.

descript.para: 170.15+, and 175.1, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, or cellulose ether or salt and phosphorus compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing sulfur:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one sulfur atom therein in addition to the cellulose xanthate.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
170.46, 191.1, and 202.1, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, cellulose ether or salt, or a cellulosic material and organic compound containing sulfur.

subclass.sctitle: Carbon double bonded directly to the sulfur:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the sulfur is double bonded directly to a carbon.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose xanthate, an organic compound which has at least one nitrogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

169.46+, 170.42+, 190.1, and 200.1+, for compositions containing lignocellulosic material, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, cellulose ether or salt, or a cellulosic material and an organic compound containing nitrogen.

subclass.sctitle: The nitrogen is a member of a hetero ring:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the nitrogen of the organic compound containing nitrogen is part of a hetero ring.

descript.para: (5) Note, for the definition of hetero ring.
170.1+, 173.01, and 200.2, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, cellulose ether or salt, or a cellulosic material and nitrogen containing hetero ring.

subclass.sctitle: Oxygen and nitrogen in the same compound (e.g., ammonium alkyl sulfonate, tertiary amine oxide, triethanolamine, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound has both oxygen and nitrogen.

descript.para: for compositions containing a cellulosic material and organic compound containing both oxygen and nitrogen.

subclass.sctitle: The oxygen is part of a -C(=O)- group (e.g., amide, urea, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the oxygen is double bonded to a carbon atom.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain in addition to the cellulose xanthate an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
for compositions containing a cellulosic material and organic compound containing oxygen.

subclass.sctitle: Natural resin or organic -C(=O)O- compound (e.g., rosin, tall oil, tallow, castor oil, carboxylic acid, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing oxygen is (a) a natural resin, or (b) a compound in which the carbon of the -C(=O)O- group is, or is attached directly or indirectly by nonionic bonding to, the carbon of an organic compound.

descript.para: for compositions containing a cellulosic material and natural resin or organic -C(=O)O- compound.

subclass.sctitle: Dihydric or polyhydric alcohol or ether derivative thereof:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing oxygen has two or more -OH groups, each of which is bonded directly to a carbon, which carbon may be single bonded to any element but may be multiple bonded only to carbon or ether derivative thereof whereby the H of the -OH group is replaced by a C.

descript.para: for compositions containing a cellulosic material and a dihydric or polyhydric alcohol.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing halogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose xanthate, an organic compound which has at least one halogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
195.1, and 201.1, for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt, cellulose ether or salt, or a cellulosic material and an organic compound containing halogen.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous or tarry residue or hydrocarbon (e.g., petroleum fraction, paraffin, olefin, acetylene, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose xanthate, a composition or compound having the characteristics of a tar or pitch no matter what the origin or an organic compound consisting exclusively of the elements carbon and hydrogen.

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are all asphalts, bitumens, pitches and tars from coal, mineral oil, cotton seed pitch and the residue from the destructive distillation of wood, and natural oil distillations.

descript.para: for compositions containing a hydrocarbon in addition to a lignocellulosic material, an organic compound containing chalcogen, and a natural resin or derivative.

subclass.sctitle: With element or inorganic compound except water:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain in addition to the cellulose xanthate elemental material or any inorganic compound except water.

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are carbon disulfide, carbon black, metal alloy, metal dust, sodium chloride, and calcium carbonate.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
and 203.1+, for compositions containing a lignocellulosic material or a cellulosic material and inorganic compound or element, other than water.

subclass.sctitle: Elemental titanium or inorganic titanium compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the inorganic compound or element is elemental titanium or an inorganic compound containing titanium.

descript.para: for compositions containing a cellulosic material and inorganic compound containing titanium.

subclass.sctitle: Elemental silicon or inorganic silicon compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the inorganic compound or element is elemental silicon or an inorganic compound containing silicon.

descript.para: 169.55, 170.57, 197.01, and 203.3, for compositions containing a lignocellulosic material, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, cellulose ether or salt, or a cellulosic material and elemental silicon or inorganic compound containing silicon.

subclass.sctitle: Cuprammonium cellulose:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the cellulosic material is cellulose in cupra-ammonium solution.

subclass.sctitle: Cellulose ester or salt thereof:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the cellulosic material is the product of the reaction of a hydroxyl group of cellulose with an acid.

note1.para: Note. The esterifying acid may be organic or inorganic.

Note. For purposes of classifying patents in this and indented subclasses, each of the following group is considered to be a single cellulose ester and not diverse cellulose esters: (a) cellulose ester of a single acid (e.g., cellulose acetate, cellulose propionate, etc.); (b) cellulose ester of mixed acids (e.g., cellulose butyrate propionate, cellulose propionate isobutyrate, etc.), or (c) mixture of cellulose esters of the same acid differ only in the degree of esterification (e.g., mixture of cellulose propionate and cellulose tripropionate, etc.).

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose nitrate as the cellulose ester.

subclass.sctitle: Cellulose nitrate:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the cellulose ester is a product produced by reacting nitric acid with cellulose, one of the principal component of which has the following structure:

note1.para: Note. Examples of cellulose nitrate included herein are pyroxylin, nitrocellulose, and gun cotton.

subclass.sctitle: With nitrogen hetero ring compound (e.g., succinimide, caprolactam, piperazine, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound having a heterocyclic ring containing nitrogen as a hetero atom in addition to the cellulose nitrate.

descript.para: (5) Note, for the definition of hetero ring.
170.1+, 173.01, and 200.2, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose ester or salt, cellulose ether or salt, or a cellulosic material and nitrogen containing hetero ring.

subclass.sctitle: The hetero ring is part of a polycyclo ring system (e.g., guanine, phthalimide, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the nitrogen containing hetero ring compound has a ring system with at least two rings which (a) share with each other two adjacent ring atoms, or (b) share with each other three or more ring atoms.

subclass.sctitle: With chalcogen hetero ring compound (e.g., lactone, maleic anhydride, furan, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound having a hetero ring containing chalcogen (i.e., oxygen, sulfur, selenium, and tellurium) as a hetero atom in addition to the cellulose nitrate.

descript.para: (5) Note, for the definition of hetero ring.
174.1+, for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt or cellulose ether or salt and chalcogen containing hetero ring.

subclass.sctitle: Plural oxygens in the hetero ring (e.g., dioxane, dioxene, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the hetero ring has two or more oxygens as ring members.

subclass.sctitle: With phosphorus compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a compound of phosphorus in addition to the cellulose nitrate.

note1.para: Note. Phosphorus compounds are often used as plasticizers and fire retardants.

descript.para: for compositions within this class containing phosphorus fireproofing or biocidal agent.
170.15+, and 175.1, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose ester or salt, or cellulose ether or salt and phosphorus compound.

subclass.sctitle: Trialkyl or triaryl phosphate or mixed esters thereof (e.g., tributyl phosphate, triphenyl phosphate, dicresyl lauryl ortho phosphate, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the formula for the phosphorus compound is PO(OR)(OR1)(OR2), where R, R1, and R2 = alkyl radical or aryl radical and where R, R1, and R2 can be the same or diverse radicals.

subclass.sctitle: With boron compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a compound of boron in addition to the cellulose nitrate.

descript.para: and 176.1, for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt or cellulose ether or salt and boron compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing silicon:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain in addition to the cellulose nitrate an organic compound which has at least one silicon atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
170.2, and 177.1, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose ester or salt, or cellulose ether or salt and organic compound containing silicon.

subclass.sctitle: With natural resin or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, a natural resin or reaction product of a natural resin.

note1.para: Note. Natural resins include but are not limited to shellac, copals from various sources (e.g., congo, manila, etc.), amber, dammar, dead dammar, gum rosin, rosin (colophony), tall oil (liquid rosin), wood rosin, burgundy pitch, gurjun balsam, canada balsam, sandrac, mastic, accroides, benzoin, elemi, gamboge, gum thus, venice turpentine, bordeaux turpentine, abietic acid, and pimaric acid.

descript.para: 170.21, and 178.1, for compositions containing natural resin or derivative and lignocellulosic material, cellulose ester or salt thereof or cellulose ether or salt thereof.
for compositions containing cellulose nitrate and chemically modified natural resin of indeterminate structure.

subclass.sctitle: Chemically modified natural resin of indeterminate structure (e.g., oxidized, polymerized, hydrogenized, esterified, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the resin undergoes oxidation, polymerization, hydrogenation, esterification or other chemical reaction products of a resin of indeterminate structure.

subclass.sctitle: With additional diverse natural resin or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain two different natural resins or derivative thereof in addition to the cellulose nitrate.

subclass.sctitle: With naturally occurring wax (e.g., mineral, ceresin, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a naturally occurring low-melting organic mixture or compound of hydrocarbons or esters of fatty acids and alcohols having the characteristics of wax (solid at room temperature) in addition to the cellulose nitrate and the resin.

subclass.sctitle: With fatty oil or derivative (e.g., coconut, cottonseed, soybean, fish, sperm oil, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the resin and cellulose nitrate, fatty oil or derivative.

note1.para: Note. By “fatty oil” are meant the glyceryl triester (triglyceride) of the same or different higher fatty acids (e.g., oleic, myristic, palmitic, stearic, linolenic, etc.) or mixtures thereof present in a single oil derived from animals or plant seeds or nuts.
Note. Examples of derivative included herein are esterified, oxidized, polymerized, vulcanized, hydrogenized fatty oil.

Note. Included herein are oils derived from plant and animal origin (e.g., castor, coconut, corn, soybean, olive, cottonseed, safflower, fish, fish-liver, sperm, etc.) and the functional oils, such as drying oils (linseed, tung, oiticica), semidrying oils (soybean, cottonseed), and nondrying oils (castor, coconut).
Note. Pine oil is not a vegetable fatty oil because its chief constituents are tertiary and secondary terpene alcohols.

subclass.sctitle: With carboxylic acid, ester, or salt thereof:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the resin and cellulose nitrate, an organic compound having a carboxylate group (i.e., -C(=O)O-) as part of a carboxylic acid, ester, or salt.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the resin and cellulose nitrate, a compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With chemically modified lanolin, fat, or fatty oil (e.g., blown, polymerized, hydrogenized, esterified, etc.)
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain blown, polymerized, hydrogenized, esterified or reaction products which still maintain the basic ester structures of a fat, lanolin, or fatty oil.

note1.para: Note. Definitions can be found in the Glossary below.

Note. Included herein are reaction products of oils derived from plant and animal origin (e.g., castor, coconut, corn, soybean, olive, cottonseed, safflower, fish, fish-liver, sperm, etc.), and of the functional oils, such as drying oils (linseed, tung, oiticica), semidrying oils (soybean, cottonseed), and nondrying oils (castor, coconut).
Note. Hydrolysis is excluded from this subclass as a chemical modification of lanolin, fat, or fatty oil since this chemical reaction produces cholesterol or glycerol and salts of higher fatty acids.

def.para: The glyceryl triester (triglyceride) of the same or different higher fatty acids (e.g., oleic, myristic, palmitic, stearic, linolenic, etc.) or mixtures thereof present in a single oil or fat (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, etc.).
Cholesterol esters of higher fatty acids.

subclass.sctitle: With lanolin, fat, or fatty oil (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, linseed oil, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, a fat, lanolin, or fatty oil.

note1.para: Note. Definitions can be found in the Glossary below.

Note. Included herein are oils derived from plant and animal origin (e.g., castor, coconut, corn, soybean, olive, cottonseed, safflower, fish, fish-liver, sperm, etc.) and the functional oils, such as drying oils (linseed, tung, oiticica), semidrying oils (soybean, cottonseed), and nondrying oils (castor, coconut).

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose nitrate and chemically modified lanolin, fat, or fatty oil.
and 179.1, for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt thereof or cellulose ether or salt thereof and lanolin, fat, or fatty oil or derivative thereof.

def.para: The glyceryl triester (triglyceride) of the same or different higher fatty acids (e.g., oleic, myristic, palmitic, stearic, linolenic, etc.) or mixtures thereof present in a single oil or fat (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, etc.).
Cholesterol esters of higher fatty acids.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to cellulose nitrate and lanolin, animal fat, or animal or vegetable oil, an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With terpene or derivative (e.g., pine oil, terpineol, borneol, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, a terpene or reaction product wherein the terpene structure is not destroyed.

note1.para: Note. Terpene denotes a hydrocarbon having two or more isoprene units (C5H8). Most terpenes have carbon skeleton of 10, 15, 20, or 30 atoms.

descript.para: and 180.1, for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt thereof or cellulose ether or salt thereof and terpene or derivative thereof.

subclass.sctitle: Camphor:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the terpene derivative is a compound of the following structure:

subclass.sctitle: With carboxylic acid, ester, or salt thereof:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain in addition to the cellulose nitrate and camphor an organic compound having a carboxylate group (i.e., -C(=O)O-) as part of a carboxylic acid, ester, or salt.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing nitrogen, halogen, or chalcogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain in addition to the cellulose nitrate and camphor an organic compound which has at least one nitrogen, halogen, or chalcogen (i.e., oxygen, sulfur, selenium, or tellurium) atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With compound of indeterminate structure prepared by reacting an organic -C(=O)O- compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, a compound of unknown structure, resulting from the reaction of an organic compound containing the -C(=O)O- group.

subclass.sctitle: With organic -C(=O)O- group containing compound except wax (e.g., fatty acid, dicarboxylic acid, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, an organic compound containing the -C(=O)O- group except wax.

note1.para: Note. Examples of compounds included herein are the carboxylic acids such as dicarboxylic acid, and fatty acid.

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose nitrate and naturally occurring wax.
and 181.1+, for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt thereof or cellulose ether or salt thereof and organic -C(=O)O- group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: Carbon bonded directly to the single bonded oxygen of the -C(=O)O- group (e.g., fatty acid ester, acid anhydride, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the single bonded oxygen of the organic -C(=O)O- group is single bonded to an additional carbon atom.

subclass.sctitle: Plural -C(=O)O- groups attached directly or indirectly to each other by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- group is attached directly or indirectly to one or more -C(=O)O- groups by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Carbocyclic ring attached directly or indirectly to the -C(=O)O- groups:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- groups are attached directly or indirectly to a benzene or an alicyclic (cycloaliphatic) ring.

note1.para: Note. Alicyclic (cycloaliphatic) denotes (1) cycloparaffins (saturated), (2) cycloolefins (unsaturated with one or more double bonds), and (3) cycloacetylenes or cyclynes (unsaturated with triple bond).

subclass.sctitle: Exactly two -C(=O)O- groups attached directly to the carbocyclic ring by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbocyclic ring is attached directly to two -C(=O)O- groups by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Oxygen, other than in -C(=O)O- group, attached indirectly to the -C(=O)O- groups by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein a noncarboxylate oxygen is attached indirectly to the -C(=O)O- groups by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Esterified dihydric or polyhydric alcohol:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the plural carboxylic acid ester groups are produced by reacting a carboxylic acid with an alcohol having two or more -OH groups.

subclass.sctitle: Nitrogen or oxygen bonded directly to the carbon of the -C(=O)O- group (e.g., diethyl carbonate, dodecyl phenylcarbamate, octyl carbanilate, urethane, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbon of the -C(=O)O- group is bonded directly to nitrogen or to oxygen.

subclass.sctitle: Oxygen attached indirectly to the -C(=O)O- group by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein a nonoxygen is attached indirectly to the -C(=O)O- group by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Benzene ring attached directly or indirectly to the -C(=O)O- group by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- group is attached directly or indirectly to a benzene ring.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen (e.g., alcohol, ketone, additional carboxylic acid esters, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein, in addition to the cellulose nitrate and the compound having carbon bonded directly to the single bonded oxygen of the -C(=O)O- group.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: Metal or nitrogen salt:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the hydrogen of the carboxylic acid is replaced by a metal or ammonium or substituted ammonium.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing sulfur:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain in addition to the cellulose nitrate an organic compound which has at least one sulfur atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
202.1, 170.46, and 191.1, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, a cellulosic material, cellulose ester or salt, or cellulose ether or salt and organic compound containing sulfur.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, an organic compound which has at least one nitrogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

166.4+, 170.42+, 190.1, and 200.1+, for compositions containing lignocellulosic material, cellulose xanthate, cellulose ester, cellulose ether or salt thereof, or a cellulosic material and organic compound containing nitrogen.

subclass.sctitle: The nitrogen is single bonded directly to the carbon of a -C(=O)- group:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing nitrogen has the carbon of a -C(=O)- group bonded directly to the nitrogen by a single bond.

subclass.sctitle: With organic -C(=O)- group containing compound (e.g., aldehyde, ketone, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, an organic compound having a -C(=O)- group.

descript.para: and 192.1, for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt thereof or cellulose ether or salt thereof and organic -C(=O)- group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: With ether except dialkylene or polyalkylene glycol:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain in addition to the cellulose nitrate an organic compound having -C-O-C- group except dialkylene or polyalkylene glycol.

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt thereof and dialkylene or polyalkylene glycol.
and 193.1, for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt thereof or cellulose ether or salt thereof and an organic -C-O-C- group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound, where the H of the -OH group can be replaced by a metal (e.g., alkanol, phenol, polyol, phenolate, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate and the ether, an organic compound having a carbon bonded directly to a hydroxyl -OH group, where metal can replace the H of the -OH group.

subclass.sctitle: With organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound, where the H of the -OH group can be replaced by a metal (e.g., alkanol, phenol, polyol, alkanolate, dialkylene glycol, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, an organic compound having a carbon bonded directly to a -OH group, where metal can replace the H of the -OH group.

descript.para: and 194.1+, for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt thereof or cellulose ether or salt thereof and organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: Halogen containing or with organic halogen compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, (a) an organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound which has at least one halogen atom therein (where a metal can replace the H of the -OH group) or (b) an organic compound which has at least one halogen atom therein and an organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound, where a metal can replace the H of the -OH group.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing halogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof and the organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound, an organic compound which has at least one halogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous or tarry residue, hydrocarbon, or naturally occurring wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, (a) a composition or compound having the characteristics of a tar or pitch no matter what the origin, (b) an organic compound consisting exclusively of the elements carbon and hydrogen, or (c) a naturally-occurring low-melting organic mixture or compound of hydrocarbons or esters of fatty acids and alcohols having the characteristics of wax (solid at room temperature).

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are alkanes, alkenes, olefins, montan wax, ceresin wax, carnauba wax, all asphalts, bitumens, pitches and tars from coal, mineral oil, cotton seed pitch and the residue from the destructive distillation of wood, and natural oil distillations.

descript.para: and 196.1, for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt thereof or cellulose ether or salt thereof and hydrocarbon, wax, bituminous or tarry residue.

subclass.sctitle: With elemental silicon or inorganic silicon compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, an elemental silicon or an inorganic compound containing silicon.

descript.para: 166.82, 170.57, 197.01, and 203.3, for compositions containing lignocellulosic material, cellulose xanthate, cellulose ester or salt, cellulose ether or salt, or a cellulosic material and elemental silicon or inorganic compound containing silicon.

subclass.sctitle: With elemental metal or alloy or metal compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain in addition to the cellulose nitrate free metal, mixture of two or more metals or of one or more metals with certain nonmetallic elements (e.g., carbon steel), or compound of metal.

descript.para: (4) Note, for the definition of an organic an alloy.
and 198.1, for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt thereof or cellulose ether or salt thereof and elemental metal or alloy or metal compound.

subclass.sctitle: With elemental carbon (e.g., graphite, coal, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose nitrate, carbon in substantially pure form including its crystalline allotrope (i.e., graphite) and amorphous allotropes (e.g., coal, coke, carbon black, etc.).

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose ether or salt thereof and elemental carbon.

subclass.sctitle: With nitrogen hetero ring compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an organic compound having a hetero ring containing nitrogen as a hetero atom.

descript.para: (5) Note, for the definition of of hetero ring.
169.1+, 173.01, and 200.2, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ether or salt, or a cellulosic material and nitrogen containing hetero ring.

subclass.sctitle: Chalcogen hetero atom:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the hetero ring compound has both nitrogen and chalcogen (i.e., oxygen, sulfur, selenium, and tellurium) as hetero atoms in the same hetero ring or has a hetero ring containing nitrogen attached directly or indirectly to a hetero ring containing chalcogen.

subclass.sctitle: With chalcogen hetero ring compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an organic compound having a hetero ring containing chalcogen (i.e., oxygen, sulfur, selenium, and tellurium) as a hetero atom.

descript.para: (5) Note, for the definition of of hetero ring.
and 174.1+, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ether or salt and chalcogen containing hetero ring.

subclass.sctitle: Three-membered hetero ring (e.g., epichlorohydrin, epoxide, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the chalcogen containing hetero ring has exactly three members.

subclass.sctitle: Plural chalcogens in the hetero ring:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the hetero ring has two or more chalcogens as ring members.

subclass.sctitle: With phosphorus compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, a compound of phosphorus.

note1.para: Note. Phosphorus compounds are often used as plasticizers and fire retardants.

descript.para: 169.14+ and 175.1, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, or cellulose ether or salt and phosphorus compound.

subclass.sctitle: Trialkyl or triaryl phosphate or mixed esters thereof (e.g., tributyl phosphate, triphenyl phosphate, dicresyl lauryl ortho phosphate, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the formula for the phosphorus compound is PO(OR)(OR1)(OR2), where R, R1, and R2 = alkyl radical or aryl radical and where R, R1, and R2 can be the same or diverse radicals.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the trialkyl, triaryl phosphate or mixed esters thereof, an organic compound which has at least one nitrogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With carboxylic acid, ester, or salt thereof:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the trialkyl, triaryl phosphate or mixed esters thereof, an organic compound containing the -C(=O)O- group.

subclass.sctitle: With boron compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a compound of boron in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof.

descript.para: and 176.1, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ether or salt and boron compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing silicon:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an organic compound which has at least one silicon atom therein.

descript.para: 169.17 and 177.1, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, or cellulose ether or salt and organic compound containing silicon.

subclass.sctitle: With natural resin or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, natural resin or a chemical modification of a natural resin.

note1.para: Note. Natural resins include but are not limited to shellac, copals from various sources (e.g., congo, manila, etc.), amber, dammar, dead dammar, gum rosin, rosin (colophony), tall oil (liquid rosin), wood rosin, burgundy pitch, gurjun balsam, canada balsam, sandrac, mastic, accroides, benzoin, elemi, gamboge, gum thus, venice turpentine, bordeaux turpentine, abietic acid, and pimaric acid.
Note. Examples of derivatives included herein are hydrogenated, esterified, polymerized, or sulfurized resin, or salt thereof.

descript.para: 169.18+ and 178.1, for compositions containing natural resin or derivative and lignocellulosic material, cellulose nitrate or cellulose ether or salt thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With chemically modified lanolin, fat, or fatty oil (e.g., blown, polymerized, hydrogenized, esterified, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, a blown, polymerized, hydrogenized, esterified or reaction products which still maintain the basic ester structures of lanolin, fat, or fatty oil.

note1.para: Note. Definitions can be found in the Glossary below.

Note. Included herein are reaction products of oils derived from plant and animal origin (e.g., castor, coconut, corn, soybean, olive, cottonseed, safflower, fish, fish-liver, sperm, etc.), and of the functional oils, such as drying oils (linseed, tung, oiticica), semidrying oils (soybean, cottonseed), and nondrying oils (castor, coconut).
Note. Hydrolysis is excluded from this subclass as a chemical modification of lanolin, fat, or fatty oil since this chemical reaction produces cholesterol or glycerol and salts of higher fatty acids.

def.para: The glyceryl triester (triglyceride) of the same or different higher fatty acids (e.g., oleic, myristic, palmitic, stearic, linolenic, etc.) or mixtures thereof present in a single oil or fat (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, etc.).
Cholesterol esters of higher fatty acids.

subclass.sctitle: With lanolin, fat, or fatty oil (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, linseed oil, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, a fat, lanolin, or fatty oil.

note1.para: Note. Definitions can be found in the Glossary below.

Note. Included herein are oils derived from plant and animal origin (e.g., castor, coconut, corn, soybean, olive, cottonseed, safflower, fish, fish-liver, sperm, etc.) and the functional oils, such as drying oils (linseed, tung, oiticica), semidrying oils (soybean, cottonseed), and nondrying oils (castor, coconut).

descript.para: and 179.1, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ether or salt thereof and lanolin, fat, or fatty oil or derivative thereof.

def.para: The glyceryl triester (triglyceride) of the same or different higher fatty acids (e.g., oleic, myristic, palmitic, stearic, linolenic, etc.) or mixtures thereof present in a single oil or fat (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, etc.).
Cholesterol esters of higher fatty acids.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With terpene or derivative (e.g., camphor, pine oil, terpineol, borneol, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, a terpene or reaction product wherein the terpene structure is not destroyed.

note1.para: Note. Terpene denotes a hydrocarbon having two or more isoprene units (C5H8). Most terpenes have carbon skeleton of 10, 15, 20, or 30 atoms.

descript.para: and 180.1, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ether or salt thereof and terpene or derivative thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With organic -C(=O)O- group containing compound except wax (e.g., fatty acid, dicarboxylic acid, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an organic compound containing the -C(=O)O- group except wax.

note1.para: Note. Examples of compounds included herein are the carboxylic acids such as dicarboxylic acid, and fatty acid.

descript.para: and 181.1+, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ether or salt thereof and organic -C(=O)O- group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: Carbon bonded directly to the single bonded oxygen of the -C(=O)O- group (e.g., fatty acid ester, acid anhydride, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic -C(=O)O- group containing compound has the single bonded oxygen of the -C(=O)O- group single bonded to an additional carbon atom.

subclass.sctitle: Nitrogen, halogen or chalcogen bonded directly to the carbon of the -C(=O)O- group (e.g., alkylchloro carbonate, diethyl carbonate, octyl carbanilate, dodecyl phenylcarbamate, urethane, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbon of the -C(=O)O- group is bonded directly to a nitrogen or to a chalcogen (i.e., oxygen, sulfur, selenium, or tellurium).

subclass.sctitle: Plural -C(=O)O- groups attached directly or indirectly to each other by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- group is attached directly or indirectly to one or more -C(=O)O- groups by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Benzene ring attached directly or indirectly to the -C(=O)O- groups by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- groups are attached directly or indirectly to a benzene ring.

subclass.sctitle: Exactly two -C(=O)O- groups attached directly to the same benzene ring by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the benzene ring is attached directly to two -C(=O)O- groups by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen (e.g., alcohol, ketone, additional carboxylic acid ester, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof and a compound containing two -C(=O)O- groups attached directly to the same benzene ring.

subclass.sctitle: Cycloaliphatic ring attached directly or indirectly to the -C(=O)O- groups by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- groups are attached directly or indirectly to a cycloaliphatic ring.

note1.para: Note. Alicyclic (cycloaliphatic) denotes (a) cycloparaffins (saturated), (b) cycloolefins (unsaturated with one or more double bonds), and (c) cycloacetylenes or cyclynes (unsaturated with triple bond).

subclass.sctitle: Esterified dihydric or polyhydric alcohol:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the plural -C(=O)O- groups are produced by reacting carboxylic acids with alcohol having two or more hydroxyl (-OH) groups.

subclass.sctitle: The polyhydric alcohol is glycerol (e.g., triacetin, tripropionin, glyceryl diproprionate, glyceryl diproprionate monoacetate, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the esterified polyhydric alcohol is an alcohol with the following structure:

subclass.sctitle: Nitrogen, sulfur, halogen, or oxygen other than in -C(=O)O- group attached indirectly to the -C(=O)O- groups by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- groups are attached indirectly to nitrogen, sulfur, ether oxygen, hydroxy (-OH), or halogen by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Nitrogen attached indirectly to the -C(=O)O- group by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- group is attached indirectly to nitrogen by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Oxygen attached indirectly to the -C(=O)O- group by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- group is attached indirectly to oxygen by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Benzene ring attached directly or indirectly to the -C(=O)O- group by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- group is attached directly or indirectly to oxygen and to a benzene ring.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen (e.g., alcohol, ketone, additional carboxylic acid ester, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof and the compound having carbon bonded directly to the single bonded oxygen of the -C(=O)O- group.

subclass.sctitle: Metal or nitrogen salt:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the hydrogen of the carboxylic acid is replaced by a metal or ammonium or substituted ammonium.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an organic compound which has at least one nitrogen atom therein.

note1.para: Note. See this class, subclass 163.01, (2) Note for the definition of an organic compound.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

166.4+, 169.46+, 190.1, and 200.1+, for compositions containing lignocellulosic material, cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ether or salt thereof, or a cellulosic material and organic compound containing nitrogen.

subclass.sctitle: Chalcogen and nitrogen in the same compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound has nitrogen and chalcogen (i.e., oxygen, sulfur, selenium, or tellurium).

subclass.sctitle: The nitrogen is single bonded directly to carbon of a -C(=X)- group (X is chalcogen):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic nitrogen compound has the carbon of a -C(=X)- group single bonded directly to the nitrogen (X is oxygen, sulfur, selenium, or tellurium).

subclass.sctitle: The nitrogen is single bonded directly to sulfur of a -S(=O)(=O)- group (i.e., sulfonamide):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound contains a -SO2N<< group.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing sulfur:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an organic compound which has at least one sulfur atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
169.45, 191.1, and 202.1, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ether or salt, or a cellulosic material and organic compound containing sulfur.

subclass.sctitle: With organic -C(=O)- group containing compound (e.g., aldehyde, ketone, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an organic compound having a -C(=O)- group.

descript.para: and 192.1, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ether or salt thereof and organic (-C(=O)-) group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: Carbocyclic ring containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound has a benzene or alicyclic (cycloaliphatic) ring attached directly or indirectly to the -C(=O)- group by nonionic bonding.

note1.para: Note. Alicyclic (cycloaliphatic) denotes (a) cycloparaffins (saturated), (b) cycloolefins (unsaturated with one or more double bonds), and (c) cycloacetylenes or cyclynes (unsaturated with triple bond).

subclass.sctitle: With organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound, where the H of the -OH group can be replaced by a metal (e.g., alkanol, phenol, polyol, phenolate, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound having a carbon bonded directly to a -OH group, where metal can replace the H of the -OH group in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof and the organic (-C(=O)-) group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: With ether except dialkylene or polyalkylene glycol:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an organic compound having a -C-O-C- group except dialkylene or polyalkylene glycol.

descript.para: and 193.1, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ether or salt thereof and organic (-C-O-C-) group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound, where the H of the -OH group can be replaced by a metal (e.g., alkanolate, alkanol, polyol, dialkylene glycol, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an organic compound having a carbon bonded directly to a -OH group, where metal can replace the H of the -OH group.

descript.para: and 194.1+, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ether or salt thereof and organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: Carbocyclic ring containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound has a benzene or alicyclic (cycloaliphatic) ring attached directly or indirectly to the -C(-OH)- group by nonionic bonding.

note1.para: Note. Alicyclic (cycloaliphatic) denotes (a) cycloparaffins (saturated), (b) cycloolefins (unsaturated with one or more double bonds), and (c) cycloacetylenes or cyclynes (unsaturated with triple bond).

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing halogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, and the organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound, an organic compound which has at least one halogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: Three or more halogens containing or with additional organic compound containing halogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof and the organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound, (a) an organic compound containing three or more halogens or (b) two or more organic compounds containing halogens.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing halogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an organic compound which has at least one halogen atom therein.

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose ether or salt thereof and organic compound containing halogen.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous or tarry residue, hydrocarbon, or naturally occurring wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, (a) a composition or compound having the characteristics of a tar or pitch no matter what the origin, (b) an organic compound consisting exclusively of the elements carbon and hydrogen, or (c) a naturally occurring low-melting organic mixture or compound of hydrocarbons or esters of fatty acids and alcohols having the characteristics of wax (solid at room temperature).

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are alkanes, alkenes, olefins, montan wax, ceresin wax, carnauba wax, all asphalts, bitumens, pitches and tars from coal, mineral oil, cotton seed pitch and the residue from the destructive distillation of wood, and natural oil distillations.

subclass.sctitle: With elemental silicon or inorganic silicon compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, an elemental silicon or an inorganic compound containing silicon.

subclass.sctitle: With elemental metal or alloy or metal compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ester or salt thereof, a free metal, a mixture of two or more metals or of one or more metals with certain nonmetallic elements (e.g., carbon steel), or a compound of metal.

descript.para: (4) Note, for the definition of alloy.
and 198.1, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ether or salt thereof and elemental metal or alloy or metal compound.

subclass.sctitle: Cellulose acetate:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the cellulose ester is cellulose acetate.

subclass.sctitle: Cellulose ether or salt thereof:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the cellulosic material is a compound having the general formula ROR4, wherein RO- is the cellulose residue moiety and R4 is an ether forming radical.

note1.para: Note. Cellulose ether is made by etherifying the hydroxyl groups of cellulose.

subclass.sctitle: With nitrogen hetero ring compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, an organic compound having a hetero ring containing nitrogen as a hetero atom.

descript.para: (5) Note, for the definition of hetero ring.
169.1+, 170.1+, and 200.2, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, or a cellulosic material and nitrogen containing hetero ring.

subclass.sctitle: With chalcogen hetero ring compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, an organic compound having a hetero ring containing chalcogen (i.e., oxygen, sulfur, selenium, or tellurium) as a hetero atom.

descript.para: (5) Note, for the definition of hetero ring.
