and 170.12+, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ester or salt and chalcogen containing hetero ring.

subclass.sctitle: The chalcogen in the ring is sulfur:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the hetero atom in the ring is sulfur.

subclass.sctitle: With phosphorus compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, a compound of phosphorus.

note1.para: Note. Phosphorus compounds are often used as plasticizers and fire retardants.

descript.para: 169.14+, and 170.15+, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, or cellulose ester or salt and phosphorus compound.

subclass.sctitle: With boron compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, a compound of boron.

descript.para: and 170.19, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ester or salt and boron compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing silicon:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, an organic compound which has at least one silicon atom therein.

descript.para: 169.17, and 170.2, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, or cellulose ester or salt and organic compound containing silicon.

subclass.sctitle: With natural resin or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, a natural resin or derivative of a natural resin.

note1.para: Note. Natural resins include but are not limited to shellac, copals from various sources (e.g., congo, manila, etc.), amber, dammar, dead dammar, gum rosin, rosin (colophony), tall oil (liquid rosin), wood rosin, burgundy pitch, gurjun balsam, canada balsam, sandrac, mastic, accroides, benzoin, elemi, gamboge, gum thus, venice turpentine, bordeaux turpentine, abietic acid, and pimaric acid.
Note. Examples of derivatives included herein are hydrogenated, esterified, polymerized, or sulfurized resin, or salt thereof.

descript.para: 169.18+, and 170.21, for compositions containing natural resin or derivative and lignocellulosic material, cellulose nitrate or cellulose ester or salt thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With lanolin, fat, or fatty oil or derivative thereof (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, linseed oil, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, lanolin, fat, or fatty oil or the derivatives thereof.

note1.para: Note. Definitions can be found in the Glossary below.
Note. Examples of derivative included herein are esterified, oxidized, polymerized, vulcanized, or hydrogenized fatty oil, fat, or lanolin.

Note. Included herein are oils derived from plant and animal origin (e.g., castor, coconut, corn, soybean, olive, cottonseed, safflower, fish, fish-liver, sperm, etc.) and the functional oils, such as drying oils (linseed, tung, oiticica), semidrying oils (soybean, cottonseed), and nondrying oils (castor, coconut).

descript.para: and 170.23+, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ester or salt thereof and lanolin, fat, or fatty oil or derivative thereof.

def.para: The glyceryl triester (triglyceride) of the same or different higher fatty acids (e.g., oleic, myristic, palmitic, stearic, linolenic, etc.) or mixtures thereof present in a single oil or fat (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, etc.).
Cholesterol esters of higher fatty acids.

subclass.sctitle: With terpene or derivative (e.g., camphor, pine oil, terpineol, borneol, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, a terpene or reaction product wherein the terpene structure is not destroyed.

note1.para: Note. Terpene denotes a hydrocarbon having two or more isoprene units (C5H8). Most terpenes have carbon skeleton of 10, 15, 20, or 30 atoms.

descript.para: and 170.25, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ester or salt thereof and terpene or derivative thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With organic -C(=O)O- group containing compound except wax (e.g., fatty acid, dicarboxylic acid, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, an organic compound containing the -C(=O)O- group except wax.

note1.para: Note. Examples of compounds included herein are the carboxylic acids such as dicarboxylic acid, and fatty acid.

descript.para: and 170.26+, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ester or salt thereof and organic -C(=O)O- group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: Carbon bonded directly to the single bonded oxygen of the -C(=O)O- group (e.g., fatty acid ester, acid anhydride, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic -C(=O)O- group containing compound has the single bonded oxygen of the -C(=O)O- group single bonded to an additional carbon atom.

subclass.sctitle: Nitrogen or chalcogen bonded directly to the carbon of the -C(=O)O- group (e.g., diethyl carbonate, dodecyl phenylcarbamate, octyl carbanilate, urethane, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbon of the -C(=O)O- group is bonded directly to a nitrogen or to a chalcogen (i.e., oxygen, sulfur, selenium, or tellurium).

subclass.sctitle: Plural -C(=O)O- groups attached directly or indirectly to each other by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- group is attached directly or indirectly to one or more -C(=O)O- groups by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Exactly two -C(=O)O- groups attached directly to the same benzene ring by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein a benzene ring is attached directly to two -C(=O)O- groups by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Esterified dihydric or polyhydric alcohol:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the plural -C(=O)O- groups are produced by reacting carboxylic acids with alcohol having two or more hydroxyl -OH groups.

subclass.sctitle: Nitrogen attached indirectly to the -C(=O)O- group by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- group is attached indirectly to nitrogen by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Oxygen attached indirectly to the -C(=O)O- group by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- group is attached indirectly to oxygen by nonionic bonding.

subclass.sctitle: Benzene ring attached directly or indirectly to the -C(=O)O- group by nonionic bonding:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the -C(=O)O- group is attached directly or indirectly to oxygen and to a benzene ring.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen (e.g., alcohol, ketone, additional carboxylic acid ester, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof and the compound having carbon bonded directly to the single bonded oxygen of the -C(=O)O- group.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing halogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof and the compound having carbon bonded directly to the single bonded oxygen of the -C(=O)O- group, an organic compound which has at least one halogen atom therein.

subclass.sctitle: Metal or nitrogen salt:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the hydrogen of the carboxylic acid is replaced by a metal or ammonium or substituted ammonium.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, an organic compound which has at least one nitrogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

166.4+, 169.46+, 170.42+, and 200.1+, for compositions containing lignocellulosic material, cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt thereof, or a cellulosic material and organic compound containing nitrogen.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing sulfur:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, an organic compound which has at least one sulfur atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
169.45, 170.46, and 202.1, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, or a cellulosic material and organic compound containing sulfur.

subclass.sctitle: With organic -C(=O)- group containing compound (e.g., aldehyde, ketone, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, an organic compound having a carbonyl -C(=O)- group.

descript.para: and 170.47+, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ester or salt thereof and organic (-C(=O)-) group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: With ether except dialkylene or polyalkylene glycol:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, an organic compound having an ether -C-O-C- group except dialkylene or polyalkylene glycol.

descript.para: and 170.5, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ester or salt thereof and organic (-C-O-C-) group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound, where the H of the -OH (hydroxyl) group can be replaced by a metal (e.g., alkanol, phenol, alkanolate, phenolate, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, an organic compound having a carbon bonded directly to a -OH group, where metal can replace the H of the -OH group.

descript.para: and 170.51+, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate or cellulose ester or salt thereof and organic- C(-OH)- group containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: Plural hydroxyl groups containing (e.g., glycol, glycerol, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound has two or more hydroxyl (-OH) groups.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing halogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof and the organic -C(-OH)- group containing compound, an organic compound which has at least one halogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing halogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, an organic compound which has at least one halogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
for compositions containing cellulose ester or salt thereof and organic compound containing halogen.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous or tarry residue, hydrocarbon, or naturally occurring wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, (a) a composition or compound having the characteristics of a tar or pitch no matter what the origin, (b) an organic compound consisting exclusively of the elements carbon and hydrogen, or (c) a naturally occurring low-melting organic mixture or compound of hydrocarbons or esters of fatty acids and alcohols having the characteristics of wax (solid at room temperature).

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are alkanes, alkenes, olefins, montan wax, ceresin wax, carnauba wax, all asphalts, bitumens, pitches and tars from coal, mineral oil, cotton seed pitch and the residue from the destructive distillation of wood, and natural oil distillations.

subclass.sctitle: With elemental silicon or inorganic silicon compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, an elemental silicon or an inorganic compound containing silicon.

subclass.sctitle: With elemental metal or alloy or metal compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, free metal, mixture of two or more metals or of one or more metals with certain nonmetallic elements (e.g., carbon steel), or compound of metal.

descript.para: (4) Note, for the definition of alloy.
and 170.58, for compositions containing cellulose nitrate, or cellulose ester or salt thereof and elemental metal or alloy or metal compound.

subclass.sctitle: With elemental carbon (e.g., graphite, coal, carbon black, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulose ether or salt thereof, carbon in substantially pure form including its crystalline allotrope (i.e., graphite) and amorphous allotropes (e.g., coal, coke, carbon black, etc.).

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing nitrogen (e.g., amine, quaternary ammonium halide, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulosic material, an organic compound which has at least one nitrogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

166.4, 169.46, 170.42, and 190.1, for compositions containing lignocellulosic material, cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, or cellulose ether or salt and organic compound containing nitrogen.

subclass.sctitle: The nitrogen is part of a hetero ring:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing nitrogen is part of a hetero ring containing nitrogen as a hetero atom.

descript.para: (5) Note, for the definition of hetero ring.
169.1, 170.1, and 172.1, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, or cellulose ether or salt and nitrogen containing hetero ring.

subclass.sctitle: Oxygen and nitrogen in the same compound (e.g., amide, ammonium alkyl sulfonate, urea, tertiary amine oxide, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing nitrogen has both nitrogen and oxygen in the same compound.

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose xanthate and oxygen attached directly or indirectly to an organic compound containing nitrogen.

subclass.sctitle: Alkanol amine or salt thereof (e.g., monoethanolamine formate, monoethanolamine hydrochloride, triethanolamine, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound has a nitrogen attached directly to the carbon of an alkyl alcohol or salt thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing halogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulosic material, an organic compound which has at least one halogen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
170.55 and 195.1, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose ester or salt, or cellulose ether or salt and an organic compound containing halogen.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing sulfur:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulosic material, an organic compound which has at least one sulfur atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
169.45, 170.46, and 191.1, for compositions containing cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, or cellulose ether or salt and organic compound containing sulfur.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulosic material, an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
for compositions containing cellulose xanthate and organic compound containing oxygen.

subclass.sctitle: Dihydric or polyhydric alcohol or ether derivative thereof:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound has two or more -OH groups, each of which is bonded directly to a carbon, which carbon may be single bonded to any element but may be multiple bonded only to carbon or ether derivative thereof, whereby the H of the -OH group is replaced by a C.

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose xanthate and dihydric or polyhydric alcohol.

subclass.sctitle: Natural resin or organic -C(=O)O- compound (e.g., rosin, tall oil, tallow, castor oil, carboxylic acid, ester wax, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing oxygen is (a) a natural resin, or (b) a compound in which the carbon of the -C(=O)O- group is, or is attached directly or indirectly by nonionic bonding to, the carbon of an organic compound.

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose xanthate and a natural resin or organic -C(=O)O- compound.

subclass.sctitle: With element or inorganic compound except water:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the cellulosic material, elemental material or any inorganic compound except water.

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are carbon disulfide, carbon black, metal alloy, metal dust, sodium chloride, and calcium carbonate.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.
and 166.8, for compositions containing lignocellulosic material or cellulose xanthate and inorganic compound or element, other than water.

subclass.sctitle: Elemental titanium or inorganic titanium compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the inorganic compound or element is elemental titanium or inorganic compound containing titanium.

descript.para: for compositions containing cellulose xanthate and inorganic compound containing titanium.

subclass.sctitle: Elemental silicon or inorganic silicon compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the inorganic compound or element is elemental silicon or inorganic compound containing silicon.

descript.para: 166.82, 169.55, 170.57, and 197.01, for compositions containing lignocellulosic material, cellulose xanthate, cellulose nitrate, cellulose ester or salt, or cellulose ether or salt and elemental silicon or inorganic compound containing silicon.

subclass.sctitle: Carbohydrate gum, dextrin or derivative (e.g., arabic, tragacanth, guar, karaya, agar agar, algin, irish moss, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbohydrate or derivative is dextrin, carbohydrate gum, or derivative thereof.

note1.para: Note. Dextrin consists of various gummy polysaccharides produced by thermal or acid degradation of starch.

Note. Carbohydrate gums are highly branched polysaccharides composed of two or more monosaccharides, and are exudations of plants produced by the plant to cover wounds and to prevent attack by organisms.
Note. Carbohydrate gums include but are not limited to arabic, tragacanth, xanthan, galactomannan, irish moss, carrageenan, karaya, agar agar, algin, guar, xylogalactan, and glucomannan.
Note. Examples of derivatives included herein are esterified, etherified, sulfonated, and borated.

subclass.sctitle: With hetero ring compound except carbohydrate:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain dextrin, or derivative thereof, an organic compound having a hetero ring in addition to the carbohydrate gum.

note1.para: Note. Hetero ring is a ring having only carbon and at least one atom from the group consisting of nitrogen, oxygen, sulfur, selenium and tellurium as ring members.

subclass.sctitle: With phosphorus compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain dextrin, or derivative thereof, a compound of phosphorus in addition to the carbohydrate gum.

subclass.sctitle: With boron compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain dextrin, or derivative thereof, a compound of boron in addition to the carbohydrate gum.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein in addition to the boron compound.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With natural resin or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain dextrin, or derivative thereof, a natural resin or a chemical modification of a natural resin in addition to the carbohydrate gum.

note1.para: Note. Natural resins include but are not limited to shellac, copals from various sources (e.g., congo, manila, etc.), amber, dammar, dead dammar, gum rosin, Japan, Japan varnish, rosin (colophony), tall oil (liquid rosin), wood rosin, burgundy pitch, gurjun balsam, canada balsam, sandrac, mastic, accroides, benzoin, elemi, gamboge, gum thus, venice turpentine, bordeaux turpentine, abietic acid, and pimaric acid.
Note. Examples of derivatives included herein are hydrogenated, esterified, polymerized, and sulfurized resins, or salts thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With terpene or derivative, lanolin, fat, or fatty oil:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain dextrin, or derivative thereof, a terpene or a chemical modification of a terpene, lanolin, fat, or fatty oil in addition to the carbohydrate gum.

note1.para: Note. Terpene denotes a hydrocarbon having two or more isoprene units (C5H8). Most terpenes have carbon skeleton of 10, 15, 20, or 30 atoms.
Note. The term “derivative” herein is intended to include a chemical modification of the terpene wherein the terpene structure is not destroyed or wherein the terpene structure is indeterminate.

def.para: The glyceryl triester (triglyceride) of the same or different higher fatty acids (e.g., oleic, myristic, palmitic, stearic, linolenic, etc.) or mixtures thereof present in a single oil or fat (e.g., lard, tallow, castor oil, etc.).
Cholesterol esters of higher fatty acids.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing sulfur or nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain dextrin, or derivative thereof, an organic compound which has at least one sulfur or nitrogen atom therein in addition to the carbohydrate gum.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen except wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the carbohydrate gum, dextrin, or derivative thereof, an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein except wax.

subclass.sctitle: The oxygen is part of a -C(=O)O- group:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing oxygen has a carboxylate group (i.e., -C(=O)O-).

subclass.sctitle: Dihydric or polyhydric alcohol:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing oxygen is an alcohol with two or more hydroxyl (-OH) groups.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous or tarry residue, hydrocarbon, or naturally occurring wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the carbohydrate gum, dextrin, or derivative thereof, (a) a composition or compound having the characteristics of a tar or pitch no matter what the origin, (b) an organic compound consisting exclusively of the elements carbon and hydrogen, or (c) a naturally occurring low-melting organic mixture or compound of hydrocarbons or esters of fatty acids and alcohols having the characteristics of wax (solid at room temperature).

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are alkanes, alkenes, olefins, montan wax, ceresin wax, carnauba wax, all asphalts, bitumens, pitches and tars from coal, mineral oil, cotton seed pitch and the residue from the destructive distillation of wood, and natural oil distillations.

subclass.sctitle: With element or inorganic compound except water:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain dextrin, or derivative thereof, elemental material or any inorganic compound except water in addition to the carbohydrate gum.

descript.para: (4) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: Starch or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the carbohydrate or derivative is a compound containing amylose and amylopectin as its main components or derivatives thereof.

note1.para: Note. Starches are heterogenous in that the amylose and amylopectin occur in different ratios to each other.
Note. Included herein are starch fractions such as amylose and amylopectin as well as modified starches (e.g., thin boiling starches, etc.).

subclass.sctitle: Starch ester:
subclass.scdesc: Compounds wherein the starch derivative results from the reaction of a hydroxyl group of starch with an acid.

note1.para: Note. The esterifying acid may be organic or inorganic.
Note. This subclass does not provide for compounds formed when the sole acid moiety entering into the formation is a halogen.

subclass.sctitle: With hetero ring compound except carbohydrate:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound having a hetero ring except a carbohydrate in addition to the starch ester.

note1.para: Note. Hetero ring is a ring having only carbon and at least one atom from the group consisting of nitrogen, oxygen, sulfur, selenium and tellurium as ring members.

subclass.sctitle: With phosphorus compound or boron compound or organic compound containing silicon:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a compound of phosphorus, a compound of boron, or an organic compound which has at least one silicon atom therein in addition to the starch ester.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing sulfur or nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one sulfur or nitrogen atom therein in addition to the starch ester.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen except wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein except wax in addition to the starch or derivative thereof.

subclass.sctitle: Oxidized starch:
subclass.scdesc: Compounds wherein the starch derivative is a starch which has undergone oxidation.

subclass.sctitle: With hetero ring compound except carbohydrate:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound having a hetero ring except a carbohydrate in addition to the oxidized starch.

note1.para: Note. Hetero ring is a ring having only carbon and at least one atom from the group consisting of nitrogen, oxygen, sulfur, selenium and tellurium as ring members.

subclass.sctitle: With phosphorus compound or boron compound or organic compound containing silicon:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the oxidized starch, a compound of phosphorus, a compound of boron, or an organic compound which has at least one silicon atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing sulfur or nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one sulfur or nitrogen atom therein in addition to the oxidized starch.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen except wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein except wax in addition to the oxidized starch.

subclass.sctitle: With hetero ring compound except carbohydrate:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound having a hetero ring except a carbohydrate in addition to the starch or derivative thereof.

note1.para: Note. Hetero ring is a ring having only carbon and at least one atom from the group consisting of nitrogen, oxygen, sulfur, selenium, and tellurium as ring members.

subclass.sctitle: With phosphorus compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a compound of phosphorus in addition to the starch or derivative thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With boron compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a compound of boron in addition to the starch or derivative thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing silicon:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the starch or derivative thereof, an organic compound which has at least one silicon atom therein.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing sulfur:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one sulfur atom therein in addition to the starch or derivative thereof.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one nitrogen atom therein in addition to the starch or derivative thereof.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: Nitrogen and oxygen in the same compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound has both nitrogen and oxygen.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen except wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein except wax in addition to the starch or derivative thereof.

subclass.sctitle: The oxygen is part of a -C(=O)O- group:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing oxygen has a carboxylate group (i.e., -C(=O)O-).

subclass.sctitle: Carbon bonded directly to the single bonded oxygen of the -C(=O)O- group:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic -C(=O)O- group containing compound has the single-bonded oxygen of the -C(=O)O- group single bonded to an additional carbon atom.

subclass.sctitle: Plural -C(=O)O- groups:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic -C(=O)O- group containing compound has two or more carboxylate groups.

subclass.sctitle: Dihydric or polyhydric alcohol:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the organic compound containing oxygen is an alcohol with two or more hydroxyl (-OH) groups.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous or tarry residue, hydrocarbon, or naturally occurring wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the starch or derivative thereof, (a) a composition or compound having the characteristics of a tar or pitch no matter what the origin, (b) an organic compound consisting exclusively of the elements carbon and hydrogen, or (c) a naturally occurring low-melting organic mixture or compound of hydrocarbons or esters of fatty acids and alcohols having the characteristics of wax (solid at room temperature).

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are alkanes, alkenes, olefins, montan wax, ceresin wax, carnauba wax, all asphalts, bitumens, pitches and tars from coal, mineral oil, cotton seed pitch and the residue from the destructive distillation of wood, and natural oil distillations.

subclass.sctitle: With element or inorganic compound except water:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain elemental material or any inorganic compound except water in addition to the starch or derivative thereof.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: Elemental halogen or halogen containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the inorganic compound or element is an inorganic compound containing halogen or elemental halogen.

subclass.sctitle: Alkali or alkaline earth metal hydroxide (e.g., caustic soda, caustic alkali, caustic lime, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the inorganic compound is an alkali metal hydroxide or an alkaline earth metal hydroxide.

note1.para: Note. The alkali metals are lithium, sodium, potassium, rubidium, cesium, and francium.
Note. The alkaline earth metals are magnesium, calcium, strontium, barium, and radium.

subclass.sctitle: Elemental silicon or silicon containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions wherein the inorganic compound or element is an inorganic compound containing silicon or elemental silicon.

subclass.sctitle: With natural resin or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a natural resin or a chemical modification of a natural resin in addition to the carbohydrate or derivative thereof.

note1.para: Note. Natural resins include but are not limited to shellac, copals from various sources (e.g., congo, manila, etc.), amber, dammar, dead dammar, gum rosin, Japan, Japan varnish, rosin (colophony), tall oil (liquid rosin), wood rosin, burgundy pitch, gurjun balsam, canada balsam, sandrac, mastic, accroides, benzoin, elemi, gamboge, gum thus, venice turpentine, bordeaux turpentine, abietic acid, and pimaric acid.
Note. Examples of derivatives included herein are hydrogenated, esterified, polymerized, and sulfurized resins, or salts thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With hetero ring compound except carbohydrate:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound having a hetero ring except a carbohydrate in addition to the carbohydrate or derivative thereof.

note1.para: Note. Hetero ring is a ring having only carbon and at least one atom from the group consisting of nitrogen, oxygen, sulfur, selenium, and tellurium as ring members.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one nitrogen atom therein in addition to the carbohydrate or derivative thereof.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound containing oxygen except wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an organic compound which has at least one oxygen atom therein except wax in addition to the carbohydrate or derivative thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous or tarry residue, hydrocarbon, or naturally occurring wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain, in addition to the carbohydrate or derivative thereof, (a) a composition or compound having the characteristics of a tar or pitch no matter what the origin, (b) an organic compound consisting exclusively of the elements carbon and hydrogen, or (c) a naturally-occurring low-melting organic mixture or compound of hydrocarbons or esters of fatty acids and alcohols having the characteristics of wax (solid at room temperature).

note1.para: Note. Examples of components included herein are alkanes, alkenes, olefins, montan wax, ceresin wax, carnauba wax, all asphalts, bitumens, pitches and tars from coal, mineral oil, cotton seed pitch and the residue from the destructive distillation of wood, and natural oil distillations.

subclass.sctitle: With element or inorganic compound except water:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain elemental material or any inorganic compound except water in addition to the carbohydrate or derivative thereof.

descript.para: (2) Note, for the definition of an organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: Natural resin or derivative containing:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions in the preparation of which a natural resin or derivative, e.g., rosin, copal, gamboge or ester gum, is employed.

note1.para: Note. For the purpose of this classification, crude products, e.g., pine tar, wood tar, wood pitch, which contain natural resins or reaction products thereof, are considered to be natural resins. Also included within the scope of natural resins are those compounds of known chemical structure containing the hydrophenanthrene nucleus which are derived from natural resins by treatment of the resin, per se.

descript.para: for polishes containing a natural resin.
for natural resins or reaction products thereof.

, 187, 270+, and 764 for a natural resin or natural rubber or derivative nonreactant material in admixture with a synthetic resin; and Classes 525, 526, 527, and 528 for a natural resin or derivative containing synthetic resin, and see in particular Class 520, subclass 1 (Note 9, B) for an explanation of the type of polymer derived from a natural resin or derivative reactant which is proper for Class 520 as well as what is considered a natural resin or derivative for that Class.

subclass.sctitle: With fat, fatty oil, fatty oil acid or salt thereof:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a fat, fatty oil, fatty oil acid or salt thereof is employed.

subclass.sctitle: Fatty oil:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a fatty oil is employed.

note1.para: Note. Many of the patents in this subclass and indented subclasses are for varnishes.

subclass.sctitle: Two or more kinds of fatty oil:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which two or more kinds of fatty oil are employed.

note1.para: Note. The fatty oils may be from different sources, or may be different forms of the same oil, e.g., mixtures of linseed oil and cotton seed oil, castor oil and Turkey red oil.

subclass.sctitle: Drying oil:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a drying oil is employed.

note1.para: Note. This subclass contains oils which are either drying or semidrying, e.g., linseed oil or cotton seed oil.

Note. The term “varnish” when broadly used is presumed to include a mixture of a natural resin and a drying oil, and patents drawn to compositions containing “varnish” recited broadly are classified on this basis, i.e., in this subclass or indented subclasses or in the appropriate subclass above.

subclass.sctitle: With sulfurizing or sulfonating agent:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a sulfurizing or sulfonating agent is employed, including those compositions in the preparation of which sulfurized or sulfonated resin or oil is employed as such.

descript.para: 247 and 249, for other natural resin or fatty oil compositions including a sulfurizing or sulfonating agent.

subclass.sctitle: With wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a wax is employed.

descript.para: 230, 231, and 245, for other natural resin or fatty oil compositions in the preparation of which a wax is employed.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous material or tarry residue:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a bituminous material or tarry residue is employed.

note1.para: Note. The bituminous material or “tarry residue” is employed in addition to the natural resin or derivative or crude products containing the same.

subclass.sctitle: With terpene or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a terpene or derivative, other than a natural resin, is employed.

subclass.sctitle: With hydrocarbon:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a hydrocarbon is employed.

descript.para: for natural resin fatty oil compositions in which the hydrocarbon is a terpene, e.g., spirits of turpentine.

subclass.sctitle: With filler, dye or pigment:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a filler, dye or pigment.

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the filler, dye or pigment is claimed broadly as such are not placed in this subclass unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection therewith.

subclass.sctitle: With wax, bituminous material or tarry residue:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a wax, bituminous material or tarry residue is employed.

note1.para: Note. See this class, subclasses 224 and 225.
Note. The bituminous material or tarry residue is employed in addition to the natural resin or derivative or crude products containing the same.

subclass.sctitle: With wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a wax is employed.

note1.para: Note. The wax employed may be either an ester type wax or a hydrocarbon wax, e.g., paraffin.

subclass.sctitle: Ester type wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which an ester type wax, e.g., beeswax or carnauba, is employed.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous material or tarry residue:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a bituminous material or tarry residue is employed.

note1.para: Note. The bituminous material and “tarry residue” is employed in addition to the natural resin or derivative or crude products containing the same.

subclass.sctitle: With sulfurizing or sulfonating agent:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a sulfurizing or sulfonating agent is employed, including those compositions in which a sulfurized or sulfonated natural resin or bituminous material is employed as such.

descript.para: 274 and 275, for other bituminous compositions in the preparation of which a sulfurizing or sulfonating agent is employed.

subclass.sctitle: With hydrocarbon:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a hydrocarbon (other than the bituminous material or tarry residue) is employed.

subclass.sctitle: With filler, dye or pigment:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a filler, dye or pigment.:

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the filler, dye, or pigment is claimed broadly as such are not placed in this subclass unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection therewith.

descript.para: 242 and 281, and indented subclasses, for other natural resin or derivative or bituminous compositions containing a filler, dye or pigment.

subclass.sctitle: With solvent or dispersing medium:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which are normally liquid and contain a definite solvent or dispersing medium.

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the solvent or dispersing medium is merely claimed broadly are not classified in this subclass or indented subclasses, unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection with the solvent or dispersing medium.

subclass.sctitle: Alcohol containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing an alcohol.

subclass.sctitle: Water containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing water.

subclass.sctitle: Hydrocarbon containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a hydrocarbon.

subclass.sctitle: With flux:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a definite flux, softener or plasticizer.

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the flux, softener or plasticizer is claimed broadly as such are not placed here unless specific proportions or some special treatments are claimed in connection therewith.

subclass.sctitle: With filler, dye or pigment:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a definite filler, dye or pigment.

note1.para: Note. Where the filler, dye or pigment is claimed broadly as such, the patent is not classified in this subclass unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection with these ingredients.

subclass.sctitle: Fibrous:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a fibrous filler, e.g., asbestos.

descript.para: for natural resin compositions containing proteinaceous fibers, e.g., hair or leather fiber.
for natural resin compositions containing cellulose fibers, e.g., cork or cotton.

subclass.sctitle: Fat, fatty oil, fatty oil acid or salt thereof containing:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions in the preparation of which a fat, fatty oil, fatty oil acid or salt thereof is employed.

descript.para: and 511 and Class 524, subclasses 284+ for a fat, fatty oil, dimer or trimer of a fatty acid as a nonreactant material in admixture with a synthetic resin or natural rubber; and Classes 525, 526, 527, and 528 for a fat, fatty oil, dimer or trimer containing synthetic resin and see in particular Class 520, subclass 1 (Note 9, A) for an explanation of the type of polymers derived from said materials which are proper for Class 520.
and definition thereof, for the definition of “fats”, “fatty oil” and “higher fatty acid”.

subclass.sctitle: Fatty oil:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a fatty oil is employed.

note1.para: Note. Many of the patents in this subclass and indented subclasses are for paints.

subclass.sctitle: With wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which wax is employed.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous material or tarry residue:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a bituminous material or tarry residue is employed.

subclass.sctitle: With sulfurizing or sulfonating agent:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a sulfurizing or sulfonating agent is employed including those compositions in which a sulfurized or sulfonated fatty oil or bituminous material or tarry residue is employed, per se.

note1.para: Note. See this class, subclasses 249, 274, and 275.

subclass.sctitle: With filler, dye or pigment:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a filler, dye or pigment.

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the filler, dye or pigment is claimed broadly as such are not placed in this subclass unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection therewith.

descript.para: 253 and indented subclasses 266 and 281 and indented subclasses for other fatty oil or bituminous compositions containing a filler, dye or pigment.

subclass.sctitle: With sulfurizing or sulfonating agent:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a sulfurizing or sulfonating agent is employed including those compositions in which a sulfurized or sulfonated oil is employed as such.

descript.para: and 247, for other fatty oil compositions with sulfurizing or sulfonating agents.
and 85 and indented subclasses for sulfur containing fatty oils, per se.

subclass.sctitle: Two or more kinds of oil:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which two or more kinds of fatty oil are employed.

note1.para: Note. The fatty oils may be from different sources, or may be different forms of the same oil, e.g., mixtures of linseed oil and cotton seed oil; linseed oil and chlorinated linseed oil.

subclass.sctitle: With filler, dye or pigment:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a pigment or filler.

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the pigment or filler is claimed broadly as such are not placed in this subclass unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection therewith.

descript.para: 248, 253+, and 266, for other fatty oil compositions containing a filler dye or pigment.

subclass.sctitle: Drying oil:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a drying oil is employed.

note1.para: Note. This subclass and indented subclasses include oils which are either drying or semidrying, e.g., linseed oil or cotton seed oil.

subclass.sctitle: With filler, dye or pigment:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a filler, dye or pigment.

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the pigment or filler is claimed broadly as such are not placed in this subclass or indented subclasses unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection therewith.

descript.para: 248, 251, and 266, for other fatty oil compositions containing a filler, dye or pigment.
especially subclass 308 for pigments, per se, and for pigments containing an oil or soap as an ingredient thereof.

subclass.sctitle: Zinc compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing zinc compound.

descript.para: and Notes thereto, for pigments, per se, including a zinc compound.

subclass.sctitle: Lithopone:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing lithopone, a composite pigment, containing zinc sulfide and barium sulfate, usually formed by double decomposition.

descript.para: and 295, for lithopone pigments or fillers, per se.

subclass.sctitle: Lead compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a lead compound.

descript.para: and 298, for pigments or fillers containing a lead compound.

subclass.sctitle: White lead:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing white lead, i.e., basic lead carbonate.

subclass.sctitle: Red lead:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing red lead, i.e., lead tetroxide.

subclass.sctitle: Iron compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing an iron compound.

descript.para: for pigments or fillers containing an iron compound.

subclass.sctitle: Calcium compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a calcium compound.

descript.para: for pigments or fillers containing a calcium compound.

subclass.sctitle: Carbonaceous:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing carbon in an elemental form.

descript.para: for pigments or fillers containing elemental carbon.

subclass.sctitle: Pigment treatment:
subclass.scdesc: Processes drawn to some specific treatment of the pigment.

note1.para: Note. Many of the patents in this subclass are for processes of transferring a pigment from an aqueous medium into an oil medium.

subclass.sctitle: With preserving or stabilizing agent:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing an agent for preserving or stabilizing the composition, e.g., anti-oxidant.

descript.para: for antioxidants or other preserving agents. For compositions, each of which contains a substance and an agent for inhibiting caking of granules of, corrosion by, or chemical change of the substance, search where the substance is classifiable.

subclass.sctitle: With drier:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing an agent which accelerates the drying of the drying oil.

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the drier is claimed broadly as such are not placed in this subclass unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection therewith.

descript.para: for driers, per se.

subclass.sctitle: With hydrocarbon:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a hydrocarbon is employed.

descript.para: for the use of hydrocarbon wax in the preparation of drying oil compositions.

subclass.sctitle: With filler, dye or pigment:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a pigment or filler.

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the pigment or filler is claimed broadly as such are not placed in this subclass unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection therewith.

descript.para: 248, 251, and 253+, for other fatty oil compositions containing a filler, dye or pigment.
especially subclass 308 for pigments, per se, and for pigments containing an oil or soap as an ingredient thereof.

subclass.sctitle: With hydrocarbon:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a hydrocarbon is employed.

descript.para: for the use of a hydrocarbon wax in the preparation of fatty oil compositions.

subclass.sctitle: With wax:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a wax is employed. The wax may be either a hydrocarbon type wax or ester type wax.

subclass.sctitle: With bituminous material or tarry residue:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a bituminous material or tarry residue is employed.

subclass.sctitle: Wax containing:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions in the preparation of which a wax is employed. Compositions in this subclass and indented subclasses may include either an ester type wax, e.g., beeswax, or a hydrocarbon wax, e.g., paraffin.

note1.para: Note. Paraffin wax admixed with a preservative is classified herein in the absence of ingredients classified above, unless the preservative is a mineral oil in which case see Class 208, Mineral Oils: Processes and Products, subclass 21.

descript.para: for the treatment of paraffin or the recovery of the same from mineral oils.
and 520, and Class 524, subclasses 275+ and 474+ for a wax nonreactant material in admixture with a synthetic resin or natural rubber.
for ester type wax, per se.

subclass.sctitle: With solvent or dispersing medium:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which are normally liquid and contain a definite solvent or dispersing medium.

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the solvent or dispersing medium is claimed broadly are not placed in this subclass, unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection therewith.

subref.clstitle: Colloid Systems and Wetting Agents; Subcombinations Thereof; Processes of Making, Stabilizing, Breaking, or Inhibiting
subref.pretext: appropriate subclasses for colloid systems or agents for such systems or making or stabilizing such systems or agents, especially

descript.para: for primarily organic continuous liquid phase colloid system (e.g., water-in-oil emulsion, dispersion of paraffin wax), subclasses 38+ for bituminous material, coal, or Carbon dispersed in a continuous aqueous phase colloid system (e.g., asphalt, pitch, tar, paraffin wax), subclasses 77+ for colloid systems of colloid-sized solid phase dispersed in aqueous continuous liquid phase (e.g., synthetic ester-wax dispersion); in each case, when generically claimed or when there is no hierarchically superior provision in the USPC for the specifically claimed art; and in the case when otherwise provided for in Class 106, when containing no material other than that to produce or stabilize the dispersion, i.e., free of dyes, pigments, other art perfecting ingredients.

subclass.sctitle: With filler, dye or pigment:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a definite filler, dye or pigment.

note1.para: Note. Where the filler, dye or pigment is merely claimed broadly, the patent is not classified in this subclass unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection with these ingredients.

subclass.sctitle: Bituminous material or tarry residue:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions in the preparation of which a bituminous material or tarry residue is employed.

note1.para: Note. See Class 404, Road Structure, Process, or Apparatus, appropriate subclasses for the combination of a Class 106 composition (or process) with structure (or steps) peculiar to road building. See note to Class 106, under class definition of Class 404.

Note. See Class 520, Synthetic Resins or Natural Rubbers, Class 523, subclasses 450 and 518, and Class 524, subclasses 59+ and 705 for a nonreactant coal or bituminous material admixed with a synthetic resin or natural rubber; and Classes 525, 526, 527, and 528 for a coal or bituminous containing synthetic resin, and see in particular Class 520, subclass 1 for an explanation of the type of polymer derived from coal or bituminous material which is proper for Class 520.

descript.para: for preparation of oxidized asphalts and the resulting products; subclasses 22+ for asphalts, tars or pitches, per se, or in admixture with each other; and subclasses 39+ for the preparation, treatment or recovery of asphalts, tars and pitches.
for physical processes of mixing asphaltic mortars which are clearly distinct from the composition.

subclass.sctitle: With sulfurizing or sulfonating agent:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which a sulfurizing or sulfonating agent is employed, including those compositions in which a sulfurized or sulfonated bituminous material or tarry residue is employed, per se.

note1.para: Note. See this class, subclasses 233 and 247.

subclass.sctitle: With filler, dye or pigment:

subclass.sctitle: Rock asphalt:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which rock asphalt is employed.

subclass.sctitle: Bituminous emulsion:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which bituminous emulsion is employed.

descript.para: for other bituminous compositions containing a solvent or dispersing medium.

subref.clstitle: Colloid Systems and Wetting Agents; Subcombinations Thereof; Processes of Making, Stabilizing, Breaking, or Inhibiting
subref.pretext: appropriate subclasses for colloid systems or agents for such systems or making or stabilizing such systems or agents, especially

descript.para: for primarily organic continuous liquid phase colloid system (e.g., water-in-oil emulsion, dispersion of paraffin wax), subclasses 38+ for bituminous material, coal, or carbon dispersed in a continuous aqueous phase colloid system (e.g., asphalt, pitch, tar, paraffin wax), subclasses 77+ for colloid systems of colloid-sized solid phase dispersed in aqueous continuous liquid phase (e.g., synthetic ester-wax dispersion); in each case, when generically claimed or when there is no hierarchically superior provision in the USPC for the specifically claimed art; and in the case when otherwise provided for in Class 106, when containing no material other than that to produce or stabilize the dispersion (i.e., Class 516 takes all bituminous emulsions, even though claimed as coating or plastic compositions, when they include nothing more than is necessary to form or stabilize the emulsion).

subclass.sctitle: With solvent or dispersing medium:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which are normally liquid and contain a definite solvent or dispersing medium.

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the solvent or dispersing medium is merely claimed broadly are not placed in this subclass, unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection therewith.

subref.clstitle: Colloid Systems and Wetting Agents; Subcombinations Thereof; Processes of Making, Stabilizing, Breaking, or Inhibiting
subref.pretext: appropriate subclasses for colloid systems or agents for such systems or making or stabilizing such systems or agents, especially

descript.para: for primarily organic continuous liquid phase colloid system (e.g., water-in-oil emulsion, dispersion of paraffin wax), subclasses 38+ for bituminous material, coal, or Carbon dispersed in a continuous aqueous phase colloid system (e.g., asphalt, pitch, tar, paraffin wax), subclasses 77+ for colloid systems of colloid-sized solid phase dispersed in aqueous continuous liquid phase (e.g., synthetic ester-wax dispersion); in each case, when generically claimed or when there is no hierarchically superior provision in the USPC for the specifically claimed art; and in the case when otherwise provided for in Class 106, when containing no material other than that to produce or stabilize the dispersion (i.e., Class 516 takes all bituminous emulsions, even though claimed as coating or plastic compositions, when they include nothing more than is necessary to form or stabilize the emulsion).

subclass.sctitle: With flux:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a definite flux or plasticizer.

note1.para: Note. Patents wherein the flux or plasticizer is claimed broadly as such are not classified in this subclass unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection therewith.

subclass.sctitle: With filler, dye or pigment:

note1.para: Note. Where the filler, dye or pigment is merely broadly claimed, the patent is not classified in this subclass unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection with these ingredients.

subclass.sctitle: With filler, dye or pigment:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a definite filler, dye or pigment.

note1.para: Note. Where the filler, dye, or pigment is merely claimed broadly as such, the patent is not placed in this subclass unless specific proportions or special treatments are claimed in connection with these ingredients.

descript.para: and 280, for other bituminous compositions containing a filler, dye or pigment.

subclass.sctitle: Fibrous:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions containing a fibrous filler.

subclass.sctitle: Water containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which water is employed. The water may be employed as such or in the form of steam, etc.

descript.para: for compositions in the preparation of which a bituminous emulsion is employed.

subclass.sctitle: Coal tar or pitch containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions in the preparation of which coal tar pitch is employed.

subclass.sctitle: Specified particle or screen-mesh size stated:
subclass.scdesc: Composition containing particles of a claimed specified size or which pass through a specifically sized mesh screen.

subclass.sctitle: Heavy metal or aluminum containing:
subclass.scdesc: Composition containing a heavy metal or aluminum atom.

subclass.sctitle: Alkali or alkaline earth metal containing:
subclass.scdesc: Composition containing an alkali or alkaline earth metal atom.

subclass.sctitle: Lime, limestone or chalk containing:
subclass.scdesc: Composition which contains lime (CaO), limestone or chalk (CaCO3).

subclass.sctitle: Elemental carbon containing:
subclass.scdesc: Composition containing elemental carbon.

subclass.sctitle: Nitrogen containing:
subclass.scdesc: Composition which contains nitrogen.
