subclass.scdesc: Composition containing phosphorus.

subclass.sctitle: Halogen containing:
subclass.scdesc: Composition containing halogen.

subclass.sctitle: Metal containing:
subclass.scdesc: Composition containing a metal.

subclass.sctitle: Nitrogen containing:
subclass.scdesc: Composition containing nitrogen.

subclass.sctitle: Hydrocarbon containing:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions in the preparation of which a hydrocarbon is employed.

descript.para: for compositions in the preparation of which a hydrocarbon wax is employed.
for a liquid fuel containing a hydrocarbon and a nonhydrocarbon.
and its daughter classes, Class 520+, Synthetic Resins, for synthetic resin compositions containing a hydrocarbon; and subclasses 719 and 759 of Class 260 for rubber compositions.

subref.clstitle: Solid Anti-Friction Devices, Materials Therefor, Lubricant or Separant Compositions for Moving Solid Surfaces, and Miscellaneous Mineral Oil Compositions

descript.para: for a lubricant containing a hydrocarbon and a nonhydrocarbon or a solid polymeric hydrocarbon and for a heavy mineral oil composition of unspecified use containing a nonhydrocarbon or a solid polymeric hydrocarbon.
for a composition containing only hydrocarbons; and subclass 945 for processes which result in a hydrocarbon drying oil.

subclass.sctitle: Inorganic materials only containing at least one metal atom:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain only inorganic materials, at least one of said materials contains a metal atom.

subclass.sctitle: Containing two or more diverse metal atoms in a single compound:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain at least two diverse metal atoms in a single compound, e.g., metal metallate and double salt, etc.

note1.para: Note. For purposes of this subclass, glass, clay, asbestos, mica, and alloys are not considered as having at least two metal atoms in a single compound and are therefore excluded herefrom.

descript.para: for a glass containing coating or plastic composition.
for a clay (kaolin, bentonite, montmorillonite, etc.) or mica containing coating or plastic composition.
for an asbestos containing coating or plastic composition.

subclass.sctitle: Fe or Co containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain an iron or cobalt atom.

subclass.sctitle: Group IV metal atom (Ti, Zr, Hf, Ge, Sn, or Pb) containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a Group IV metal atom, i.e., Ti, Zr, Hf, Ge, Sn, or Pb.

note1.para: Note. Thorium for the purpose of this subclass is excluded herefrom.
Note. Glass, per se, is considered as being lead containing unless the disclosure is devoid of teaching lead in a glass composition.

subclass.sctitle: Aluminum containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain aluminum.

note1.para: Note. Clay is a generic term and properly includes, but is not limited to, kaolin, bentonite, montmorillonite, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Group II metal atom (Be, Mg, Sr, Ca, Ba, Ra, Zn, Cd, or Hg) containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a Group II metal atom, i.e., Be, Mg, Sr, Ca, Ba, Ra, Zn, Cd, or Hg.

note1.para: Note. Asbestos is properly classified herein.

subclass.sctitle: Group I metal atom (Li, Na, K, Rb, Cs, Fr, Cu, Ag, or Au) containing:
subclass.scdesc: Compositions which contain a Group I metal atom, i.e., Li, Na, K, Rb, Cs, Fr, Cu, Ag, or Au.

descript.para: for a glass containing coating or plastic composition.

subclass.sctitle: Inorganic materials only:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain inorganic materials only.

note1.para: Note. This subclass includes mixtures of compounds or elements containing nonmetal atoms.

subclass.sctitle: Silicon containing other than solely as silicon dioxide or as part of an aluminum-containing compound:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain a silicon atom other than in a compound of aluminum or as SiO2, per se.

descript.para: for a composition containing “a silicone” or “silicone oil” otherwise unidentified.
for an aluminum-containing compound containing a silicon atom.
for a coating composition containing a silicon atom solely as SiO2 containing compositions.

subclass.sctitle: N-containing Si compound:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions wherein the compound which contains the silicon atom also contains a nitrogen atom.

descript.para: for compositions with nitrogen-containing compounds which also contain the carbonyl group.
for compositions containing a nitrogen-containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: -OH bonded directly to Si atom:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions wherein an -OH group is directly bonded to a silicon atom.

subclass.sctitle: C bonded directly to Si atom:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain silicon bonded directly to carbon.

note1.para: Note. When a substituent is claimed as a monovalent radical and is otherwise unidentifiable, placement is proper in this subclass.
Note. A composition containing “a silicone” or “silicone oil” otherwise unidentifiable is classified here.

subclass.sctitle: H or alkyl directly bonded to Si:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions in which the silicon atom is directly attached to a hydrogen atom or alkyl group.

subclass.sctitle: C radical bonded to Si is unsaturated:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions wherein the organic radical attached to the silicon atom has at least one ethylenically unsaturated bond.

subclass.sctitle: Si-O-C bonded compound:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain a compound having a Si-O-C- linkage.

subclass.sctitle: Aluminum compound containing:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions containing an aluminum compound.

note1.para: Note. This subclass includes clays.

subclass.sctitle: Heavy metal compound containing:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain compounds of metals with a specific gravity greater than 4.

note1.para: Note. Heavy metal as used here includes arsenic and antimony.

subclass.sctitle: Group IVA or IVB (Ti, Zr, Hf, Ge, Sn, Pb):
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain a compound of titanium, zirconium, hafnium, germanium, tin, or lead.

subclass.sctitle: Heterocyclic (only N, O, S, Se, Te):
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain a ring whose members are composed solely of at least one carbon and one or more atoms of the elements nitrogen, oxygen, sulfur, selenium, and tellurium.

subclass.sctitle: Two hetero ring atoms:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions wherein a compound contains at least two hetero ring atoms.

note1.para: Note. The hetero atoms do not have to be diverse.

subclass.sctitle: Epoxy ring containing:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions wherein a compound contains an oxirane ring.

subclass.sctitle: O-containing organic compound:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain an oxygen-containing organic compound.

subclass.sctitle: Carbonyl group containing:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contains a carbonyl radical, i.e., -C=O.

note1.para: Note. In the absence of a clear showing to the contrary, a compound claimed as a “drying oil” is classifiable herein.

subclass.sctitle: N containing:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions in which the compound containing the carbonyl radical also contains a nitrogen atom.

subclass.sctitle: Hydroxy group containing or alcoholate:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic composition which contains an C-OH group or is an alcoholate thereof.

subclass.sctitle: Halogen containing:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain elemental fluorine, chlorine, bromine, iodine, or astatine or compounds thereof.

subclass.sctitle: Organic halide:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions in which the molecule containing a halogen atom is organic in nature.

subclass.sctitle: Phosphorus or nitrogen containing:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain phosphorus or nitrogen or a compound thereof.

subclass.sctitle: Nitrogen containing:
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain nitrogen or a compound thereof.

subclass.sctitle: Sulfur containing:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain sulfur or a compound thereof.

subclass.sctitle: Silicon dioxide containing:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions which contain SiO2, per se.

note1.para: Note. This includes colloidal silicon and silica aerogel.

subclass.sctitle: Miscellaneous:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Coating or plastic compositions not otherwise provided for.

subclass.sctitle: Driers:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Materials or ingredients specialized for use to accelerate the rate of drying of coating or plastic compositions. These materials are usually intended for use with fatty oil compositions, e.g., paints, varnishes, etc.

descript.para: for drying oil compositions containing a drier.
for salts of fatty oil acids which are useful as driers.

subclass.sctitle: Vehicles or solvents:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Materials or ingredients specially designed for use as a solvent or vehicle to be used in the production of coating or plastic compositions.

descript.para: and indented subclasses and subclass 285 for vehicles including a fatty oil or a hydrocarbon.
for other solvents.

subclass.sctitle: Opacifiers for enamels:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Materials or ingredients specially designed for use in producing opacity in glass, usually in the form of vitreous enamels or glazes.

descript.para: and 49, for enamels or glazes including an opacifier, and subclasses 299 and 300, for titanium or zirconium containing pigments or fillers.

for a composition containing a synthetic resin or natural rubber, having utility as an enamel for a glass substrate or as a medium or binder in the preparation of glass enamel or to processes of preparing said composition.

subclass.sctitle: Ceramic fluxes:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Materials or ingredients specially designed for use as ceramic fluxes which, when mixed with a ceramic composition, reduce the melting or softening temperature of the same.

descript.para: and indented subclasses, for ceramic compositions including a flux.

subref.clstitle: Specialized Metallurgical Processes, Compositions for Use Therein, Consolidated Metal Powder Compositions, and Loose Metal Particulate Mixtures

descript.para: for flux compositions for use with molten metals.

subclass.sctitle: Miscellaneous:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Materials or ingredients not otherwise provided for.

descript.para: for materials or ingredients of coating or plastic compositions which are single compounds or are reaction mixtures.
for materials or ingredients of coating or plastic compositions which are single compounds or are reaction mixtures

subclass.sctitle: Pigment, filler, or aggregate compositions, e.g., stone, shale, pebbles, rock, etc.:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Materials or ingredients specialized for use as pigments, fillers, or aggregates in coating or plastic compositions.

note1.para: Note. This class and indented subclasses include all pigments, fillers or aggregates which are specialized for use in producing coating or plastic compositions whether or not the said coating or plastic compositions are classified in this class, e.g., synthetic resins, rubber, paper fillers, etc.

Note. When a composition contains no “identified material” other than a material such as rock, stone, etc., which may have varied compositions in the art, it is placed in this subclass, unless the stone or rock is specifically defined by the patent. See the definition of “identified material” in the definitions (1) Note, of subclass 401 of this class.

descript.para: appropriate subclasses for processes of producing pigments, involving comminution.
appropriate subclasses for pigments, fillers or aggregates which are single compounds or are reaction mixtures.
appropriate subclasses for pigments, fillers or aggregates which are single compounds or are reaction mixtures.

subref.pretext: appropriate subclasses for a stock material product of that class including elements of structure (e.g., crimped fibers) and especially

descript.para: for a rod, strand or fiber with structure (e.g., varying cross-section, physical dimension, etc.) or with a coating.

subref.pretext: appropriate subclasses, particularly Class 524, for a pigment, filler or aggregate composition, otherwise proper for Class 106,

descript.para: when the composition contains a synthetic resin or rubber.

subclass.sctitle: Composition contains identified material other than water:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains material, other than water, which meets the definition of identified material for these subclasses.

note1.para: Note. For the purposes of subclasses 401-506 of this class “identified material” is defined to mean material wherein at least one chemical atom is identified, e.g., amine, hydrocarbon, alcohol, ether, etc. Identified material is material wherein at least one of the chemical atoms can be deduced with certainty. For purposes of these subclasses, organic material although inherently reciting the presence of a carbon atom is considered to be too broad. An exemplary list of materials to be regarded as identified material is as follows: metal hydrate, chalcogen, carboxylic acid, peroxy, peroxide, alkali or alkaline earth metal, halogen, sulfide, oil, fat, fatty acid or ester, etc. Identified material is by no means limited to the above noted examples. The list below is not exhaustive and merely enumerates certain materials that will not be considered as identified material, e.g., organic compound, metal containing, inorganic compound, organometallic, solvent, pigment, aggregate, filler, hydrophobic, hydrophillic, plasticizer, preservative, antioxidant, stabilizer, lubricant, fibrous, particulate, liquid, solid gas, dispersant, emulsifier, surfactant, surface active agent, crystalline, plastic, fluorescent, phosphorescent, luminescent, deliquescent, drier, humectant, blue color, numerically described without providing a chemical atom, Lewis acid or base, mineral, organic solvent, co-solvent, free radical, amphoteric, anionic, cationic, ionic, dielectric, conductor, insulator, etc.

Note. While water fits the intent of what one would consider an identified material under this definition, water is positively excluded from subclasses 401+ as not sufficient by itself to place a composition in these subclasses.

Note. For subclass indents, the same requirement for identified material obtains, for example, a composition containing organic solvent and a phthalocyanine would not be sufficient to bring a composition into subclass 413, etc.

Note. Special terms used in the subclass titles, whether meeting the definition of identified material or not, are considered sufficient to bring a composition into the subclass, e.g., cork, fly ash, organic refuse, mica, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Lake containing:
subclass.scdesc: Pigments which contain carbon compound dyes absorbed in or absorbed on particles of salts, inorganic hydroxides or other compounds, e.g., aluminum hydroxide, barium sulfate, etc.

note1.para: Note. See Class 260, Chemistry of Carbon Compounds, appropriate subclasses for compositions which contain definite chemical compounds of dyestuff or organic pigment compounds with metals. Carbon coloring compounds which are produced in the presence of a preformed substratum, wherein novelty is alleged to reside in the combination or in the amount, form, or nature of the substratum, are in this class (106); however, where the substratum is synthesized simultaneously with the carbon compound, the product belongs in Class 260.

subclass.sctitle: Elemental metal or alloy containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains an elemental metal or alloy.

subref.clstitle: Specialized Metallurgical Processes, Compositions for Use Therein, Consolidated Metal Powder Compositions, and Loose Metal Particulate Mixtures

descript.para: for a composition having a continuous phase of free metal made by consolidating metal particles, and subclasses 251+ for a loose metal particle composition.
appropriate subclasses for methods and means for making metal particles mechanically.
for metallic stock material having metal particles which may be made, for example, by coating a composition containing metal particles on a nonparticulate metal substrate.

subclass.sctitle: Aluminum containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains aluminum.

subclass.sctitle: Fly ash, coal ash, or bottom ash or derived therefrom:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains fly ash, bottom ash or coal ash or contains a material whose source is indicated to be such ash material.

subclass.sctitle: Cork, bark, vegetable shell, hull or cob, or material derived therefrom:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains cork, bark, vegetable shell, hull or cob, or contains material whose source was one of these materials.

subclass.sctitle: Organic refuse or waste material containing or derived therefrom:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains material identified as waste or refuse material or as having been derived from such a source; however, waste polymer material, e.g., used to produce carbon black, etc., is excluded from this subclass.

subclass.sctitle: Alkali blue pigment containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains an alkali blue pigment.

note1.para: Note. Alkali blue pigment is considered to be a pigment having an arylpararosaniline sulfonic acid type formula.

subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein at least some of the particles in the composition are hollow or porous or are particles of foam material.

subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains more than one phthalocyanine or derivative compound.

subclass.sctitle: Special process of milling, grinding, comminuting, plural stage or zone mixing or product:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein there is recited a specific method of milling, grinding, or comminuting or multiple stages or zones are recited in a mixing process or product thereof.

note1.para: Note. Mere recitation of milling, grinding, comminuting, or mixing is not sufficient to place a patent in this subclass, but specific parameters of operation must be recited.

subclass.sctitle: With organic compound:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains an additional organic compound other than phthalocyanine or derivative.

subclass.sctitle: Ultramarines, e.g., ultramarine green, etc.:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains ultramarine, a complex blue pigment made up of sodium polysulfides with sodium and aluminum silicates, e.g., ultramarine green, etc.

subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains mica.

note1.para: Note. Mica is generally defined as a group of silicates characterized physically as flat, six-sided monoclinic crystals, all of which contain hydroxy, an aluminum silicate, and an alkali. Included within the term mica are biotite, muscovite, phlogopite, zinnwaldite, isinglass, and muscovy glass.

subclass.sctitle: Zinc oxide containing:

note1.para: Note. Commonly, high alumina or calcium aluminate cements are those containing a large proportion of aluminium oxide, together with lime, and smaller amounts of iron oxide and silica, and are formed by fusion of the raw materials. The ordinary high alumina cement contains approximately forty percent alumina.

subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving compositions containing asbestos, e.g., amosite, chrysotile, fibrous actinolite, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Slag, ash or organic material containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including slag, ash or organic material.

subclass.sctitle: Calcium sulfate containing (e.g., gypsum, plaster of Paris, anhydrite, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including calcium sulfate, e.g., plaster of Paris, anhydrite, gypsum, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate, shale or rock containing or material for treating soil or earth (e.g., soil stabilization, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, shale, slate or rock or material for treating soil or earth.

descript.para: for earth treatment or control employing cement.

subclass.sctitle: Portland type cement:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including portland type cement.

subclass.sctitle: Lime containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including lime.

subclass.sctitle: Ash containing (e.g., fly ash, volcanic ash, coal ash, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving compositions containing ash, e.g., fly ash, volcanic ash, bottom ash, coal ash, etc.

note1.para: Note. Any material identified merely as ash is proper for this subclass; however, heavier residues of burning such as cinders, clinkers, etc. are not intended for this subclass if so identified.

subclass.sctitle: Soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, shale, slate or rock containing or material for treating soil or earth (e.g., soil stabilization, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, shale, slate or rock or material for treating soil or earth.

descript.para: for earth treatment or control employing cement.

subclass.sctitle: With slag, coke, cinder, stack dust, kiln dust or flue dust:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing slag, coke, cinder, stack dust, kiln dust, or flue dust.

subclass.sctitle: Organic material containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including organic material.

subclass.sctitle: Portland type cement:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including portland type cement.

subclass.sctitle: With additional lime:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including lime additional to the lime content of the ash material.

subclass.sctitle: Mineral fibers or glass fibers containing (e.g., slag wool, cotton wool, mineral wool, rock wool, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter which includes glass fibers or mineral fibers, e.g., slag wool, cotton wool, mineral wool, rock wool, etc.

descript.para: for mineral fibers, per se.

subclass.sctitle: Color additive (other than whitener):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including a color additive other than a whitener.

subclass.sctitle: Portland type cement:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing a composition containing portland type cement.

descript.para: for portland type cement, per se, and processes of preparing same.

subclass.sctitle: Slag containing (e.g., blast furnace slag, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition also contains slag, e.g., blast furnace slag, etc.

note1.para: Note. As slag, a byproduct from various metallurgical processes, is a relatively indefinite or broad term in the art, this subclass is intended to take compositions referred to as slag by the applicant and where appropriate the claims may also be crossed elsewhere based upon the disclosure by applicant as to the specific composition of the slag.

subclass.sctitle: Calcium sulfate specified (e.g., gypsum, anhydrite, plaster of Paris, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition also contains calcium sulfate, e.g., plaster of Paris, anhydrite, gypsum, etc.

subclass.sctitle: With mica, talc, cinder, glass, vermiculite, coke breeze or kiln dust:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains mica, talc, cinder, vermiculite, coke breeze, or kiln dust.

subclass.sctitle: Boron, elemental carbon or phosphorus containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains boron, elemental carbon or phosphorus.

subclass.sctitle: Soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate or shale containing, or material for treating soil or earth (e.g., soil stabilization, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate, or shale or material for treating soil or earth.

descript.para: for earth treatment or control employing cement.

subclass.sctitle: Organic material containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition also includes organic material.

subclass.sctitle: Carbohydrate:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including carbohydrate material, e.g., plant material, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Silica or lime added:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains lime or silica in addition to that contained in the portland cement, per se.

subclass.sctitle: Calcium sulfate specified (e.g., gypsum, anhydrite, plaster of Paris, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains calcium sulfate specified in the claims.

subclass.sctitle: Process involving steam, electrical, magnetic or wave energy, vibration or vacuum or product thereof:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving a process employing steam, electrical, magnetic or wave energy, vibration or vacuum.

subclass.sctitle: Organic material containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including organic material.

subclass.sctitle: Organic sulfur compound:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including an organic sulfur containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: Cellulose or silica containing (e.g., sand, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition also contains cellulose or silica, e.g., sand, plant material, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Organic nitrogen compound:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including an organic nitrogen containing compound.

subclass.sctitle: Carboxylic acid, ester or salt thereof:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains a carboxylic acid or an ester, or salt of a carboxylic acid.

subclass.sctitle: Carbohydrate:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including a carbohydrate.

subclass.sctitle: Starch, dextran, cellulose ether or gum:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter containing starch, dextran, a cellulose ether or a gum.

subclass.sctitle: Plant material (e.g., vegetable fiber, wood, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter containing plant material, e.g., vegetable fiber, wood, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Calcium sulfate specified (e.g., gypsum, anhydrite, plaster of Paris, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter also including calcium sulfate.

subclass.sctitle: Titanium, vanadium, chromium, molybdenum, tungsten, manganese, iron, copper, zinc, tin or lead compound containing (Ti, V, Cr, Mo, W, Mn, Fe, Cu, Zn, Sn, Pb):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including a compound of titanium, vanadium, chromium, molybdenum, tungsten, manganese, iron, copper, zinc, tin, or lead.

subclass.sctitle: Halogen containing (F, Cl, Br, I):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter containing a halogen, e.g., fluorine, chlorine, bromine or iodine.

subclass.sctitle: Calcium sulfate specified (e.g., gypsum, anhydrite, plaster of Paris, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein calcium sulfate is specifically claimed.

note1.para: Note. Calcium sulfate is commonly added to portland cement clinker material, per se, and is often already present in the basic cement employed in making cement compositions. This subclass is not intended to include said routine calcium sulfate containing cement compositions, but only compositions where applicant specifically recites calcium sulfate in the claimed composition.

subclass.sctitle: Sulfur containing (e.g., alum, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including sulfur or a sulfur compound.

subclass.sctitle: Silica containing (e.g., sand, quartz, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains added silica other than the silica of the portland cement, per se, e.g., sand quartz, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Rock, gravel, stone or carbonate containing (e.g., limestone, dolomite, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter containing rock, gravel, stone or a carbonate, e.g., limestone, dolomite, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Portland type cement, per se (e.g., clinker preparation, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving portland type cement, per se, which is usually formed by sintering or calcining a mixture of calcareous and argillaceous materials to produce a sintered “clinker” which is subsequently ground to a finely divided state.

subref.clstitle: Drying and Gas or Vapor Contact With Soilds

descript.para: appropriate subclasses for processes of drying portland type cement raw material and for processes of cooling portland type cement clinker by solid and gas or vapor contact.
appropriate subclasses for the preliminary treatment of cement raw material by classifying, separating or assorting.
appropriate subclasses for filtration or other means of separation of liquid from cement raw material.
for processes of comminuting solids, such as clinker, etc.

for methods of generating and applying heat to materials which do not undergo a chemical reaction during the heating. Processes which involve “calcining”, “dead-burning”, “removing water of hydration”, etc. are considered to involve a chemical reaction and, when applied to the manufacture of portland type cement, are classified herein. Residual apparatus for performing such processes is in Class 432.

subclass.sctitle: Process involving spray drying, atomizing of solid material, steam, nonatmospheric pressure, cleaning step or avoiding contamination of equipment:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including processes involving spray drying, atomizing, of solid material, steam, nonatmospheric pressure, cleaning step or avoiding contamination of equipment.

subclass.sctitle: Color control or modification (e.g., steps to produce white cement, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving color control or modification of color of the cement, e.g., steps or additives to produce white cement, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Cooling in reducing atmosphere:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving cooling in a reducing atmosphere.

subclass.sctitle: Control of a parameter of operation in response to a measurement or test or to vary a result in a process:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving control of a parameter of operation in response to a measurement or test or to vary a result in a process.

subclass.sctitle: Employment of a fluidized bed:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing a fluidized bed.

note1.para: Note. A fluidized bed is defined here to mean a bed of solid particles with gas flowing upward through the particles with sufficient velocity to keep the particles suspended and in motion in the gas without blowing them bodily out of the bed. The suspended particles act much like a fluid.

Note. A stirred bed is generally not considered a fluidized bed. However, when an applicant refers to a fluidized bed, the patent should be included in this subclass and also any other appropriate subclass, regardless of whether it meets the strict definition.

subclass.sctitle: Waste material employed as raw material or fuel (not kiln dust):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing waste material as the raw material or fuel.

note1.para: Note. Kiln dust is not considered a waste material for the purposes of this subclass.

subclass.sctitle: Electrical, magnetic or wave energy employed (e.g., electric arc, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing electrical, magnetic or wave energy, e.g., electric arc, electrostatic, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Use of heat transmitting or conducting solid material for cooling solid material from gas or for modifying temperature of solid material:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving the use of heat transmitting or heat conducting solid material for cooling (or precipitating) solid material from gas or modifying the temperature of solid material.

subclass.sctitle: Aftertreatment of clinker:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving aftertreatment of clinker, i.e., sintered raw material.

subclass.sctitle: Refire or recalcine clinker:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving refiring, resintering or recalcining the clinker.

subclass.sctitle: Specified cooling (e.g., recycling heated coolant, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving specified cooling of the clinker, e.g., recycling the heated coolant gas obtained in the step of cooling the clinker, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Involving kiln dust (e.g., recovery, treatment, processing thereof or product, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving kiln dust, e.g., intentional recovery, treatment, purifying, processing thereof, etc.

note1.para: Note. Incidental production of kiln dust, inherent in clinker production is not sufficient for classification in this subclass.

subclass.sctitle: Treatment or removal of alkali, sulfurous or chloride impurities from raw material or fuel:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving treatment or removal of alkali, sulfurous or chloride impurities from raw material or fuel.

subclass.sctitle: Agglomerate, pellet, molded or shaped form of raw material:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving agglomerate, pellet, molded or shaped form of raw material.

subclass.sctitle: Sheet, film, layered, brick, briquette, block, fiber, strand, cake or egg shape:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the raw material is layered, egg-shaped, or in the form of a sheet, film, brick, briquette, block, fiber, strand or cake.

subclass.sctitle: Fuel containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the agglomerated composition also contains fuel.

subclass.sctitle: Classifying, sorting, separating, screening, sizing, grading or subdividing solid material (e.g., centrifugal separation, flotation, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving classifying, sorting, separating, screening, sizing, grading or subdividing solid material, e.g., centrifugal separation, flotation, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Comminuting or grinding, other than nominal, of raw material or fuel (e.g., to desired size or relative sizes, etc.) or recited particle of specified size:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving comminuting, or grinding, in a specified manner, of raw material or fuel, e.g., to desired size or relative sizes, etc. or recited particle of specified size is claimed.

note1.para: Note. Mere recitation of milling, grinding or comminuting is not sufficient to place a patent in this subclass, but specific parameters of operation must be recited.
Note. Composition containing a grinding aid material is placed above in portland cement compositions unless the additive material is clearly not present after the grinding.

subclass.sctitle: Raw material and fuel premixed or specified fuel:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving raw material and fuel premixed before firing or specified fuel, e.g., composition of the fuel.

subclass.sctitle: Flow of gases to produce turbulence (e.g., spiral, helical, venturi, centrifugal, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein a particular flow of gas designed to produce turbulence is employed, e.g., centrifugal, venturi, spiral, helical pattern, etc.

note1.para: Note. Mere flow of air countercurrent to the flow of raw material or fuel is deemed routine in the art and not considered sufficient alone to place in this subclass.

subclass.sctitle: Shape, angle, intensity or condition of fuel or flame specified (e.g., jet, oscillating, plural streams, spray, temperature, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the shape, angle, or other descriptive condition of the fuel or flame is specified, e.g., jet, spray, oscillating, plural streams, temperature, duration, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Recycling exhaust gas, reusing heat from process, or purifying exhaust gas:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving recycling of exhaust gas, reusing heat from process, or purifying exhaust gas.

descript.para: for recycling of reheated cooling gas, used to cool clinker.

subclass.sctitle: Processing of exhaust gas prior to recycling (e.g., purifying, separating constituents, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving special processing of exhaust gas, prior to recycling to prepare the gas for said recycling, e.g., purifying, separating constituents, etc.

descript.para: for purifying to remove certain impurities.

subclass.sctitle: Ash containing raw material:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the raw material includes ash.

subclass.sctitle: Organic material or sea shell containing raw material:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the raw material includes organic material or sea shell.

subclass.sctitle: Calcium sulfate containing raw material:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the raw material includes calcium sulfate, i.e., the calcium sulfate is present prior to sintering, not a subsequent additive.

subclass.sctitle: Phosphorus, boron, chromium, molybdenum, vanadium, or nickel containing raw material (P, B, Cr, Mo, V, Ni):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the raw material includes phosphorus, boron, chromium, molybdenum, vanadium or nickel.

subclass.sctitle: Slag containing raw material:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the raw material includes slag, e.g., blast furnace slag, etc.

note1.para: Note. As slag is a relatively indefinite or broad term in the art, this subclass is intended to take compositions referred to as slag by the applicant and where appropriate the claims may also be crossed elsewhere based upon the disclosure by applicant as to the specific composition of the slag.

subclass.sctitle: Potassium, halogen or sulfur containing raw material (K, F, Cl, Br, I, S):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the raw material includes potassium, fluorine, chlorine, bromine, iodine or sulfur.

subclass.sctitle: Iron or manganese containing raw material (Fe, Mn):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the raw material includes iron or manganese.

subclass.sctitle: Slurry employed:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing a slurry.

subclass.sctitle: Preprocessing or processing of raw material before firing (e.g., preheating, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving preprocessing or processing of raw material before firing, e.g., preheating, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Calcium sulfate (e.g., gypsum, anhydrite, plaster of Paris, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing calcium sulfate, e.g., plaster of Paris, anhydrite, gypsum, etc.

descript.para: for processes using calcium sulfate as a starting material in the making of portland type cement.
for calcium sulfate, per se.

for methods of generating and applying heat to materials which do not undergo a chemical reaction during the heating. Processes which involve “calcining”, “dead-burning”, “removing water of hydration”, etc. are considered to involve a chemical reaction and, when applied to the manufacture of calcium sulfate cement, are classified herein. Residual apparatus for performing such processes is in Class 432.

subclass.sctitle: Soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate or shale containing, or material for treating soil or earth (e.g., soil stabilization, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate, or shale or material for treating soil or earth.

descript.para: for earth treatment or control employing cement.

subclass.sctitle: Organic material containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including organic material.

subclass.sctitle: Anhydrous calcium sulfate (e.g., anhydrite, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing anhydrous calcium sulfate, e.g., anhydrite, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Organic material or slag containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter also containing organic material or slag.

subclass.sctitle: Keene"s cement:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing Keene"s cement.

note1.para: Note. When a patent refers to Keene"s cement, it is appropriate for this subclass. Commonly, Keene"s cement is dead burned gypsum ground to a desired fineness.

subclass.sctitle: With organic material:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including organic material.

subclass.sctitle: Carbohydrate:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter containing a carbohydrate.

subclass.sctitle: Cellulose (e.g., wood, cork, bark, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter containing cellulose, e.g., plant material, wood, cork, bark, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Silicon, sulfur, nitrogen or phosphorus containing organic material:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition includes silicon, sulfur, nitrogen, or phosphorus containing organic material.

subclass.sctitle: Slag, cinder, mica, talc, glass, boron or elemental carbon containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including slag, cinder, mica, talc, glass, boron, or elemental carbon.

subclass.sctitle: Layered or coated material, nominal molding or shaping, or other physical process (e.g., steam, electrical, magnetic or wave energy, manipulative steps, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving layered or coated material, nominal molding or shaping, or other physical process, e.g., manipulative steps, steam or electrical, magnetic or wave energy, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Particle size specified:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the particle size or relative size of any ingredient is specified.

subclass.sctitle: Stabilizer, retarder, or setting agent specified:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter involving use of a specified material which is indicated to be a stabilizer, retarder or setting agent for the composition.

subclass.sctitle: Byproduct gypsum (e.g., phosphogypsum, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing byproduct gypsum, e.g., phosphogypsum, etc.

note1.para: Note. Byproduct gypsum is simply gypsum indicated to have been derived as a byproduct of another process.

subclass.sctitle: Alum or halogen containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including alum, fluorine, chlorine, bromine or iodine.

subclass.sctitle: Silica containing (e.g., sand, quartz, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including silica, e.g., sand, quartz, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Slag:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing a composition containing slag.

note1.para: Note. As slag, a byproduct from various metallurgical processes, is a relatively indefinite or broad term in the art, this subclass is intended to take compositions referred to as slag by the applicant and where appropriate the claims may also be crossed elsewhere based upon the disclosure by applicant as to the specific composition of the slag.

descript.para: for a process employing slag as a raw material in making portland cement.

subclass.sctitle: Organic material, soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate, shale, or rock-type material containing or material for treating soil or earth (e.g., soil stabilization, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing organic material, soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate, shale or rock type material or material for treating soil or earth.

descript.para: for earth treatment or control employing cement.

subclass.sctitle: Lime containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including a specified filler or organic material.

subclass.sctitle: Lime:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing lime, i.e., calcium oxide or calcium hydroxide.

subclass.sctitle: Soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate or shale containing, or material for treating soil or earth (e.g., soil stabilization, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate, or shale or material for treating soil or earth.

descript.para: for earth treatment or control employing cement.

subclass.sctitle: Organic material or halogen containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing organic material or fluorine, chlorine, bromine or iodine.

subclass.sctitle: Organic material containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing organic material.

subclass.sctitle: Silica-lime mixtures:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing silica, e.g., sand or quartz.

subclass.sctitle: Fiber containing or step of molding or shaping of material:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including fiber or involving a step of molding or shaping of material.

subclass.sctitle: Iron, sulfur or aluminum containing (e.g., alum, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including iron, sulfur or aluminum, e.g., alum, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Aluminum or sulfur containing (e.g., alum, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including sulfur or aluminum, e.g., alum, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Magnesium compound containing (e.g., quicklime, dolomite, talc, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including a magnesium compound, e.g., quicklime, dolomite, talc, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Magnesium compound (e.g., vermiculite, talc, soapstone, dolomite, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing a magnesium compound, e.g., magnesium oxide or hydroxide, talc, soapstone, vermiculite, dolomite, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Organic material containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition includes organic material.

subclass.sctitle: Soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate or shale containing, or material for treating soil or earth (e.g., soil stabilization, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate, or shale or material for treating soil or earth.

descript.para: for earth treatment or control employing cement.

subclass.sctitle: Carbohydrate containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition includes a carbohydrate.

subclass.sctitle: Cellulose or plant material:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition contains cellulose or plant material.

subclass.sctitle: Organic silicon, organic boron or organic phosphorus:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including organic silicon, organic boron or organic phosphorus containing material.

subclass.sctitle: Mineral oil or hydrocarbon oil:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including mineral oil or hydrocarbon oil.

subclass.sctitle: Organic nitrogen:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including an organic nitrogen containing material.

subclass.sctitle: Organic sulfur:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including an organic sulfur containing material.

subclass.sctitle: Organic acid or derivative:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including an organic acid or derivative.

subclass.sctitle: Soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate or shale containing, or material for treating soil or earth (e.g., soil stabilization, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing soil, diatomaceous earth, clay, slate, or shale or material for treating soil or earth.

descript.para: for earth treatment or control employing cement.

subclass.sctitle: With added silica (e.g., sand, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including silica other than that contained in the clay, soil, diatomaceous earth, slate or shale.

subclass.sctitle: Synthetic zeolite or so-called mineral polymer containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter employing a mineral polymer, e.g., synthetic zeolite, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Mica, cinder, glass or elemental carbon containing:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition also contains mica, cinder, glass, or elemental carbon.

subclass.sctitle: Boron, sulfur, or halogen containing (e.g., alum, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition also contains fluorine, chlorine, bromine, iodine, boron, or sulfur, e.g., alum, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Particle size specified:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein particle size of any material in the composition is specified.

subclass.sctitle: Rock, stone, gravel, trass, shell or carbonate containing (e.g., limestone, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the composition also contains rock, stone, gravel, trass, shell or carbonate, e.g., limestone, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Process involving a temperature of zero degrees C or below:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter including a proceess involving a temperature of zero degrees C. or below.

subclass.sctitle: Additive materials for inorganic cements which contain a hydraulic settable material:
subclass.parent: the unnumbered subclass, COATING OR PLASTIC COMPOSITIONS
subclass.scdesc: Materials or ingredients specifically designed to be added to inorganic cements which contain a settable material.

note1.para: Note. Many of the patents in this and indented subclasses are for water-proofing agents, stabilizers, retarders or setting agents to be added to settable compositions.

subref.pretext: and Class 423, Chemistry of Inorganic Compounds, appropriate subclasses

descript.para: for materials or ingredients of coating or plastic compositions which are single compounds or are reaction mixtures.

subclass.sctitle: Expanding, foaming or porosity producing additive:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the additive material serves for producing porosity in, foaming or expanding inorganic cements.

subclass.sctitle: Protein containing additive:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter containing protein.

subclass.sctitle: Wax, tallow, oil, natural resin or higher fatty acid or salt, amide, or ester thereof containing additive (e.g., rosin, tall oil, hydrocarbon oil, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter containing wax, tallow, oil, natural resin or higher fatty acid or salt, amide, or ester thereof, e.g., rosin, tall oil, hydrocarbon oil, etc.

note1.para: Note. For the purposes of this subclass, higher fatty acid is defined as a long-chain alphatic monocarboxylic acid, characterized by having the carbonyl of the carboxylic acid bonded directly to one end of an acyclic chain of at least seven uninterrupted carbons, i.e., the acid moiety.

subclass.sctitle: Organic material containing additive (e.g., carbohydrate, bituminous material, etc.):
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter containing organic material, e.g., carbohydrate, bituminous material, etc.

subclass.sctitle: Soil stabilization:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the coating or plastic composition alters the mechanical or hydraulic properties of soil.

subclass.sctitle: Low molecular weight hydrocarbon polymer-containing mixture:
subclass.scdesc: Subject matter wherein the coating or plastic composition contains a hydrocarbon polymer of molecular weight under 100 or is a liquid.

forncols.forintro: The definitions below correspond to abolished subclasses from which these collections were formed. See the Foreign Art Collection schedule of this class for specific correspondences. [Note: The titles and definitions for indented art collections include all the details of the one(s) that are hierarchically superior.]

descript.para: Foreign art collection including coating or plastic compositions in the preparation of which a waste reside or liquor for the processes of liberating cellulose; e.g., by the sulfite, sulfate, or soda processes, or fraction thereof, is used.
Foreign art collection including compositions in the preparation of which tall oil or reaction product thereof is employed.
Foreign art collection including coating or plastic compositions in the preparation of which a protein or derivative thereof is employed.
Foreign art collection including compositions in which the protein is gelatine or glue, or a reaction product thereof.
Foreign art collection including compositions in the preparation of which a carbohydrate or derivative thereof is employed.
Foreign art collection including compositions in the preparation of which cellulose or a derivative thereof is employed.
